loans.name: Danaya  3 Group

texts.fr:
Les  membres du groupe  DANAYA  3 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 35 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles traditionnelles à Pourè, un des villages de San, 4ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur troisième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est   l’arachide  Mme   TARA , 1ere debout  de la droite vers la gauche, sur la photo. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte  acheter des intrants, semence, des petits matériels agricoles et payer les frais de labour  pour l’exploitation de 1,5 hectare. 
La production sera vendue au niveau du village et à San, après la récolte, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice  de 90.000 FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the Danaya 3 group are married women who are, on average, 35 years old with four children each. They all live in traditional families in Pourè, one of the villages of the commune of San (fourth administrative region of Mali).

They have joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to successfully carry out their farming activities during the rainy season. They are on their third loan with the institution and have duly repaid their previous loans.

Tara, a member of the group, grows groundnut. In the photo, she is in the standing row, first from the right.

She plans to use her loan to buy agricultural inputs, seeds, small tools, and to cover the cost of plowing to cultivate 1.5 hectare (3.7 acres) of land.

After the harvest, she will sell her production to both men and women in her own village and in San. She is expecting to make a profit of 90,000 CFA francs per growing season. This profit will allow her to repay her loan and to help her husband with the daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs, seeds, small tools, and to cover the cost of plowing.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en: Gloria is now a widow. She is the mother of four children. To make a living, she has been selling vegetables and various other grocery items in their village for 13 years. Gloria’s children are all now married, thus she is living on her own. To make the most of her income, she keeps working hard to earn income daily and save for the future. Gloria wants a loan of PHP 25,000 to buy soap, toothpaste and various vegetables to sell. She believes that, by selling a variety of goods, she will satisfy customer demand and, at the same time, earn a better income.

loans.use: to buy soap, toothpaste and various vegetables to sell in her store.

loans.name: Zosima

texts.en:
Zosima is a married woman. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. She is 44 years old and has three children who are in school.

Zosima buys and sells dry goods business in the Philippines. Zosima requested a 12000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more pants, curtains, shorts, and other items for her business.

Zosima has been in this business for 12 years. In the future, Zosima would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more pants, curtains, shorts, and other items for her business.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en: Nenita is 63 years old, married, and has six children. Nenita works very hard to provide for them. Nenita runs a general store in the Philippines and has applied for a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell in her store, including shampoo, cream, milk, coffee, and noodles. Nenita would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell in her general store, such as shampoo, cream, milk, coffee and noodles.

loans.name: Lela

texts.en:
Lela is 39 years old. She is married and lives with her husband and 3-year-old daughter in Rustavi district. Lela requested loan from local financial institutions several times for family business start-up, but she had no success. Her loan request was rejected every time because of her low income and her family’s poor living conditions. 

Lela works as a seller in a local shop. Her husband works as a driver on private orders. They both earn small monthly salaries.

Lela requested loan from Credo to start up a family business. Lela has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages providing business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. With her credit, Lela will start trading clothes. She will purchase them at wholesale prices and resell them with a price mark up among the villagers. Lela will work as hard as she can to make her business successful. This new business initiative financed with the Kiva start-up loan will give Lela an opportunity to earn an additional income for the family and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to start trading clothes.

loans.name: Sor's Group

texts.en: Sor is 54 and lives with her family members in a rural village located in the Sa Ang district of Kandal Province. She is a widow with three children. She has been farming rice for 34 years. The current business earns her about 20,000 KHR per day, and she manages to save about 8,000 KHR each day for future needs. Sor has been with VisionFund for four cycles, while the other member of the group has been with VisionFund for three cycles. Sor successfully used the loans from VisionFund to improve her family’s living conditions, and now she is confident of making a better living. Sor, who is the leader, is applying for a loan from VisionFund to buy fertilizer, pesticides and seeds for her farm. She hopes this loan will enable her to earn more income from the current business, so as to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, pesticides and seeds for her farm.

loans.name: Thoern's Group

texts.en: Thoern, 36, is married and lives with her family in a village in the Moung Russey district of Battambang province, Cambodia. She has four children, two of whom are dependent on her and still in school, while the other two are still too young for school. For the last ten years, Thoern and her husband have been farming rice on a six-hectare farm as the family’s main source of income. Together, they can earn about 25,000 KHR per day from the current business. Thoern has been with VisionFund for two cycles, while the other member of the group has been with VisionFund for one cycle. Thoern completely repaid the past loans, which have helped her provide her family with sufficient food. Now she is leading her group to apply for a loan. As the leader, Thoern is going to use her portion of the loan to buy rice seed and fertilizer for her farm. She hopes this loan will enable her to achieve higher crop yields, so she can earn a better living and keep her child in school.

loans.use: to buy rice seed and fertilizer for her farm.

loans.name: Adilia Esperanza

texts.es: Adilia, es una señora que vela por el bienestar de sus hijos quienes estudian,  cada vez van creciendo y sus gastos son mayores, ella se apoya con su esposo con quien comparte los consumos del hogar. Adilia tiene la necesidad de construir el muro perimetral de su casa, para brindarle seguridad a su familia, ya que el barrio donde habita es una zona marginal por lo que requiere mejor seguridad. Es por eso que solicita el crédito para poder comprar materiales de construcción  para empezar la obra.
texts.en:
Adilia is a woman who looks after the well-being of her school-aged children. As they grow, they have more and more expenses. She has the support of her husband, with whom she shares the household expenses. 

Adilia needs to build a perimeter wall for her house to provide security for her family. They require better security because they live in a neighbourhood in a marginalized zone. Therefore, she is requesting a loan to buy construction materials to begin the work.

loans.use: To buy blocks, iron, sand and cement.

loans.name: Mi Bendicion Group

texts.es: Este grupo está formado por tres socios empresarios  uno de ellos es Jeyser tiene 30 años de edad, casada y con un hijo menor de edad, su negocio es la venta de zapatos usados, pulpería de granos básicos y ropa nueva desde hace 2 años. Sus productos los comercializan en su comunidad, Tiene de ser cliente de la institución 1 año. El crédito lo  solicita para invertir en la compra de inventario de zapatos usados, compra de ropa nueva como pantalones, camisas, faldas, shores, blusas, camisolas y compra por quintal de arroz, frijoles, azúcar, bidón de aceite, cajas de jabón, etc. Valeria es una mujer que tiene 29 años de edad y su negocio es la venta de ropa nueva y Juan tiene 34 años de edad  y su negocio es la venta de ropa nueva.
texts.en:
This communal bank has three members, one of whom is Jeyser. She is 30 and married and has a young son. For two years, she has sold used shoes and run a small grocery store, where she sells basic grains and new clothing. She offers her merchandise in her neighborhood and has been a client of this institution for a year. She will use the loan to buy inventory: used shoes; new clothing such as pants, blouses, skirts, shirts, and camisoles; sacks of rice, beans, and sugar; oil, cases of soap, and more. 

Valeria is 29 and sells new clothing. Juan is 34 and sells new clothing.

loans.use: to buy used shoes; new clothing such as pants, blouses, skirts, shirts, and camisoles; sacks of rice, beans, and sugar; oil and cases of soap, etc.

loans.name: Ma. Rosabelle

texts.en: Ma. Rosabelle is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a dried fish retail business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 27,000 through NWTF to buy more fish to sell to her customers. Ma. Rosabelle successfully repaid her previous loan and is now applying for a new loan to further build her business. NWTF is re-listing Ma. Rosabelle's business profile in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Ritchel

texts.en: Ritchel works hard to support her family. Ritchel is married and has a business buying and selling ready-to-wear clothing in the Philippines. Ritchel has applied for a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks of pants, blouses, shirts and curtains to sell. Ritchel has been in this business for four years. Ritchel would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of pants, blouses, shirts and curtains to sell.

loans.name: Salome

texts.en: As a widowed parent of six children, Salome works hard to support her family. She has a general store in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from food-vending. Salome is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy more goods to sell in her store, such as snack foods, soft drinks, sugar, soy sauce and other groceries. Salome has been maintaining her business activities with her past 16 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more goods to sell in her store, such as snack foods, soft drinks, sugar, soy sauce and other groceries.

loans.name: Sreypich's Group

texts.en: Residing in the Moungkul Borey district of Banteay Meanchey province, Sreypich is 27 years old, married, and has two children who are still in school. She earns a living by buying and selling shampoo in her village, while her husband earns extra income by working as a paid taxi driver. Having been in business for six years, Sreypich and her husband are able to earn about KHR 20,000 per day, and he manages to save about KHR 7,000 each day after covering daily expenses. Sreypich has been with VisionFund for three cycles, while the other member of the group has been with VisionFund for two cycles. Now, she is leading her group to apply for a loan. Sreypich, who is the leader, will use her portion of the loan to buy more shampoo for resale. She hopes to increase her yield so as to make more income for her family.

loans.use: to buy more shampoo for resale.

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Kamboinsin Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Mme LIMATA est responsable du groupe KAMBOINSIN BENKADI.   Mariée, elle est mère de 03 enfants. Le plus âgé a 09ans et le moins âgés à 01 an.  01 va à l’école. 
Mme vend de la bouillie depuis 04ans. Elle s’approvisionne au marché de son secteur. Ses clients sont les enfants et les femmes du quartier. 
Elle veut s’acheter 02 sacs de mil et 01 sac de sucre pour la préparation de la bouillie. 
Elle veut épargner ses bénéfices afin de renforcer son activité. Mme ambitionne étendre les limites de son activité et mieux s’occuper de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Limata is the representative of the KAMBOINSIN BENKADI group.  She is married and the mother of three children.  Her oldest child is 9 years old and the youngest is 1.  One of her children is in school.

Limata has been selling porridge for four years.  She buys her supplies at her local market and sells to children and women in her neighborhood.

She wants to buy two bags of millet and one bag of sugar to prepare some porridge.

Limata wants to save her profits in order to boost her business.  Her goal is to expand her activity and to better provide for her children.

loans.use: to buy two bags of millet and one bag of sugar to prepare some porridge.

loans.name: Flor De Manzana Joyabaj Group

texts.es:
La señora Josefa esta casada, cuenta con 58 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, tiene 5 hijos y de ellos 1 esta estudiando, se dedica a la agricultura, siembra maíz y frijol, inició este negocio con un capital pequeño y hasta el momento lleva 30 años de experiencia; cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien también se dedica a la agricultura.

Organiza un grupo y solicita un préstamo que lo utilizará pra la compra de fertilizante, semillas y fungicidas para sus cosechas, aparte de lo que siembra actualmente desea el en futuro sembrar hortalizas. Las demás integrantes del grupo se dedican a la siembra de maíz, frijo, ejote francesa y arbeja china.
texts.en:
Josefa is married and 58. She did not have the chance to go to school. She has five children, one of whom is a student. She is a farmer and grows corn and beans. She started her business with a small amount of capital and now has 30 years of experience. Her husband, also a farmer, is supportive.

She organized a communal bank to apply for a loan, which she will use to buy fertilizer, seed, and fungicides for her plantings. She wants to also plant vegetables in the future. The other group members plant corn, beans, French green beans, and Chinese peas.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Isaias 6.9 Group

texts.es: El grupo está formado por cuatro socios emprendedores, una de ella es Lisseth  mujer de 41 años de edad, acompañada. Su negocio es la venta de platanito, enchilada y yuca frita desde hace 4 años, sus productos los comercializa ambulante. El crédito lo solicita para la compra de materia prima como es el canasto de plátanos, el saco de yuca, leñas, aceite, sal etc. Luis es un hombre de 23 años de edad y su negocio es la zapatería, María es una mujer de 22 años y su negocio es la venta de ropa nueva y Guadalupe es una mujer de 42 y se dedica al negocio de la pulpería.
texts.en:
The communal bank comprises four entrepreneurs, one of whom is Lisseth. She is 41 and lives with her partner. She has been selling bananas, enchiladas, and fried yuca for four years as a street vendor. She will use the loan to buy commodities like baskets of bananas, sacks of yuca, wood, oil, salt, and more. 

Luis is 23 and runs a shoe store. María is 22 and sells new clothing. Guadalupe is 42 and owns a small grocery shop.

loans.use: to buy commodities like baskets of bananas, sacks of yuca, wood, oil, salt, and more.

loans.name: Albina

texts.en:
Albina is 63 years old, a married woman with eight children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Albina has a fishing business in the Philippines. Albina requested an 18,000 Philippine Peso (PHP) loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

Albina has been in this business for 43 years. In the future, Albina would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment

loans.name: Dora Liliana

texts.es: Dora Liliana es una mujer de 49 años de edad, es soltera y no tiene hijos. Actualmente se dedica a la venta de comidas rápidas los días jueves, viernes, sábado y domingo, actividad que alterna con la venta de productos por catálogo y mercancía en general. Es una persona muy trabajadora, juiciosa y dedicada, por lo cual es reconocida en el sector donde reside. Con el crédito que solicita desea comprar insumos (carnes frías, panes, salsas) y también comprará productos por catálogo (pijamas, lencería, accesorios, perfumería, ropa) con el fin de incrementar sus ventas y por ende, sus ingresos para el sostenimiento de su hogar. Su principal sueño es hacer crecer su negocio de comidas para poder generar oportunidades de empleo a otras personas.
texts.en:
Dora Liliana is 49 and single and has no children. She sells fast food on Thursday, Friday, Saturday, and Sunday. She augments this business by selling catalog items and general merchandise. She is recognized in her neighborhood as hardworking, judicious, and determined.

She will use the loan to buy supplies (cold cuts, bread, sauces) and catalog merchandise (pajamas, lingerie, accessories, perfume, clothing) to increase sales and income to pay household expenses. Her main dream is to grow her food business so that she can offer jobs to other people.

loans.use: to buy supplies (cold cuts, bread, sauces) and catalog merchandise (pajamas, lingerie, accessories, perfume, clothing)

loans.name: Khatuni

texts.en:
Khatuna is 49 years old. She lives in Khashuri district with her 22-year-old son and 27-year-old daughter. Khatuna requested loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. Her loan requests were rejected every time because of low income and the family's poor living conditions.

Khatuna's son is working as a security guard on a small monthly salary. This is the only source of the income for the family.

Khatuna requested loan from Credo to start up a family business. Khatuna has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as "high risk borrowers" because of their low income. 

With her credit Khatuna will purchase 2 milk cows. She will be milking the cows every day to produce dairy products. The products will be sold at the local markets and among the villagers. Khatuna will work as hard as she can to expand her agriculture and increase the family's income. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: To purchase 2 milk cows.

loans.name: Pridon

texts.en:
Fifty-five-year-old Pridon lives in the Kutaisi district with his 15-year-old daughter. Pridon requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for family business start-up, but without any success. His loan requests were rejected every time because of low income and the family's poor living conditions.

Pridon's wife is working abroad and the only source of income for the family is her monthly transfers.

Pridon requested a loan from Credo to start up a family business. Pridon has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as "high risk borrowers" because of their low income. 

With his credit Pridon will start trading coffee. He will purchase at the wholesale price from the resellers and distribute the coffee to local shops with the mini-bus that he owns. Rather than hire a drive Pridon will drive the bus himself in order to decrease expenses. Pridon will work as hard as he can to make his business successful to expand it in the future. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will increase the family income and Pridon will be able to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: To start trading with coffee

loans.name: Henry Jose

texts.es: El señor Henry habita en el municipio de Ticuantepe junto a su esposa e hijos, el sueña que en un futuro puedan mejorar sus condiciones de vida,  el  labora para un empresa Privada y quiere terminar de construir su casa para que sus hijos puedan vivir mejor, su mayor dificualtad es que no puede recaudar de una sola vez el dinero para la compra de Materiales ya que siempre se le presentan incombenientes, con este credito podra comprar: Bloques, Cemento, Arena , Hierro y podra construir parte de su vivienda agradece el apoyo que Afodenic en conjunto a Fondos Kiva le ha brindado.
texts.en: Henry lives in the city of Ticuantepe with his wife and children. He dreams of improving their standard of living. He works for a private company and wants to finish building his house so that his children can live better. His main obstacle is not being able to gather all the money he needs at one time to buy building materials, as other issues always come up. With this loan, he will be able to buy blocks, cement, sand, and iron so that he can build part of his house. He thanks Afodenic and Kiva for their support.

loans.use: to buy building materials.

loans.name: Tamar

texts.en:
Tamar is 24 years old. She is married and lives with her 26-year-old husband and 4-year-old daughter in Akhaltsikhe district. Tamar requested loan from local financial institutions several times for family business start-up, but without any success. Her loan request was rejected all the time, because of low income and her family’s poor living conditions. 

The main source of the income for the family is from trading. Tamar sells dishes and her husband sells fruit and vegetables. Tamar is purchasing dishes from the local market in the capital city at the wholesale price and sells with a price markup among the villagers. They both earn small monthly incomes, which are barely enough to cover all the household expenses.

Tamar requested a loan from Credo to start-up a family business. Tamar has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. 

With her credit Tamar will purchase more stock of dishes for resale. As she will have a bigger stock of dishes Tamara will not have to travel to the capital city so often. This will significantly decrease her expenses and increase the profit. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva Start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: To purchase more stock of dishes for resale

loans.name: Merab

texts.en:
Merab is 27 years old. He lives in a small village of the Tsetskhlauri, Kobuleti district with his wife and parents. Merab requested loans from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan requests were rejected every time because of his low income and the family's poor living conditions.

The main source of income for the family is from agricultural activities. In particular, they have a plot of land where mandarin trees and maize are grown. Harvested products are sold at the local markets.

Merab requested a loan from Credo to start up a family business. Merab has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as "high risk borrowers" because of their low income. 

With his credit Merab will purchase a mini-bus. He will start working on a bus-line. Merab will drive the bus and increase the family's income. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will give Merab an opportunity to insure a better life for his family.

loans.use: To purchase a mini-bus and drive on a bus-line

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan  se dedica a la cría de ganado vacuno para la producción de leche la cual vende a Pil Andina (Planta Industrializadora de Leche) El vive con su esposa y sus hijos, en su casa propia ubicada en la comunidad de Huayrocondo, del Sector Batallas de La provincia Los Andes del Departamento de La Paz a tres horas  de distancia  de la ciudad de La Paz cuenta con  algunas cabezas de ganado de raza mejorada las cuales requieren mejor cuidado dada las condiciones climatológicas del sector

Necesita crédito para la compra de alimento suplementario, asi podra mejorar la nutrición del ganado y la producción lechera por las siguientes características de la cascarilla de SOYA, es un subproducto del procesamiento industrial de la soya y muy voluminoso.
Tiene un alto contenido de carbohidratos (75%) y azúcares solubles (2%).
En el altiplano existe déficit en la disponibilidad de proteína, principalmente en la época de estiaje (meses de junio a noviembre), razón por el cual es importante suplementar con cascarilla de soya como fuente de proteína para el ganado.


El sueño de Juan, es incrementar sus cabezas de ganado, precautelando la buena salud de ellos.

Es la segunda vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera    vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Juan raises cattle to produce milk that he sells to Pil Andina (an industrial milk plant).  He lives in his own house with his wife and their children in the community of Huayrocondo, in the Batallas area of the Los Andes province, in the department of La Paz.  This is 3 hours from the city of La Paz.  Juan has a number of head of an improved breed of cattle who need a lot of care, given the area's weather conditions.

Juan needs a loan to buy supplementary feed.  This way, he can improve the nutritional status of his cows and their milk production.  This feed contains soy husks, a by-product of industrial soy production which is very bulky.  It has a high carbohydrate content (75%) and soluble sugars (2%).  In the highlands, there is a shortage of available protein, mainly during the dry season (from June through November).  This is why it is important to supplement the feed with soybean husks, which provide protein for the cattle.

Juan's dream is to increase his herd of cattle, while maintaining their good health. 

This is the second time that he has requested a loan with IMPRO, and the first time with KIVA.

loans.use: to buy supplemental feed for his cattle

loans.name: Sharifa

texts.en:
Sharifa is 45 years old, divorced, and has one son. She is an IDP (internally displaced person) who lives with her son in the Bilasuvar IDP Settlement. She is a Fuzulu refugee. 

She has dedicated 10 years of her life to agriculture. She plants tomatoes, potatoes, eggplants and other vegetables and fruits. Her income from vegetable and fruit sales is 100 AZN. She has more plans for the future, such as to get more lands for cultivation.  She is looking forward to increased sales in the coming summer because people purchase fruits a lot.

She has applied for a loan of 2,000 AZN at Aqroinvest. This loan is to buy new fertilizers and seeds. It will help her  to grow more vegetables and fruits in order to get more revenue in the coming summer, which will help her to support her needs.

Sharifa appreciates your support.

loans.use: to buy new fertilizers and seeds.

loans.name: Tamar

texts.en:
Tamar is 28 years old. She lives in the Kutaisi district, West Georgia, with her husband and retired mother in-law. Tamar requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. Her loan requests were rejected every time because of her low income and the family's poor living conditions.

Tamara's brother is working abroad and he is sending transfers to the family. Their additional income is Tamar's mother-in-law's monthly pension.

Tamar requested a loan from Credo to start up a family business. Tamar has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as "high risk borrowers" because of their low income. 

With her credit Tamar will purchase furniture for her newly renovated apartment and rent it out. The apartment that Tamar owns is in Batumi district. As Batumi district is very crowded with tourists Tamar will easily rent out her apartment at a good price. This will give her an opportunity to increase the family's income. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: To purchase furniture for an apartment and rent it out

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy ceramic tiles, cement and pay for labour costs.

loans.name: Nelson Miguel

texts.es: Nelson hombre de 47 años de edad, soltero. Su negocio es la venta de lotería desde hace 11 años. Sus productos los comercializa ambulante en las calles de Masaya y su comunidad. El crédito que está solicitando es para la compra de un lavandero y la reparación del portón de su casa
texts.en: Nelson is 47 years old and single. He has been selling lottery tickets for 11 years. He sells his products on the streets of Masaya and his community. The loan he seeks is to buy a sink and repair the garage gate of his home.

loans.use: to buy a sink and repair the garage gate to his home by buying pipes, sheet metal, laborers, anti-rust paint, etc.

loans.name: Fidélité Group

texts.fr: La cliente Muteba est leader du collectif d’affaire « Fidélité», entrepreneur expérimentée, âgée de 42 ans, mariée et mère de 8 enfants qui étudient tous. Son conjoint est officier militaire dans les forces armées loyalistes. La cliente est vendeuse des épices. Elle installe ses produits à son domicile. Elle commença ses affaires avec  son fonds propre reçu de son mari, Il y a environ 6 ans. Ce nouveau prêt va lui servir d’acheter les épices.  La pourriture de ses produits constitue un défi pour l’avancement de son business. Ainsi, elle souhaite accroitre son entreprise, scolariser, nourrir ses enfants et construire une maison pour ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour son soutien en microcrédit aux petits entrepreneurs.
texts.en:
The borrower, Muteba, is the leader of the business group "Fidélité".  She is 42 years old and an experienced entrepreneur.  She is also the mother of eight children who all attend school.  Her husband is a military officer in the DRC army.  Muteba herself sells spices, displaying her goods at home.  She started in this business about six years ago, using her own funds received from her husband.

This new loan will help Muteba to buy some spices. The decay of her merchandise is one of the challenges that she faces in the development of her business.

Muteba would like to expand her business, feed and educate her children and build a house for them.

In the end, she would like to thank Hekima for the support it provides to small-scale entrepreneurs, through micro-credit.

loans.use: to buy spices.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George, 26, lives in Kitsnisi village in the Gori district with his parents, his wife and three children (1, 3 and 5 years old). 

George has requested loans from local financial institutions several times for family business start-ups, but without any success. His loan requests were rejected all the time because of his low income and the family’s poor living conditions.
 
The only source of the income for the family is from agricultural activities. They own a plot of land, where they grow vegetables. Also they have milks cows. The cows are milked every day to produce dairy products. Harvested products with the dairy products are sold at the local markets.
 
George requested a loan from Credo to start a family business. George has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. 

With his credit George will start trading cheese. He has a car, which will be used for trading. George will purchase cheese at the wholesale price from the market in his village, bring it to the capital city and sell with a price markup at the local market there.  The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: To start trading cheese.

loans.name: Tariel

texts.en:
Tariel, 62, lives in Akhalsopeli in the Khelvachauri district with his 54-year-old wife and his son. 

Tariel has requested loans from local financial institutions several times for family business start-ups, but without any success. His loan requests were rejected all the time because of his low income and the family’s poor living conditions.
 
The family runs an agricultural business. In particular, they have two milk cows and a plot of agricultural land. The cows are milked every day to produce dairy products. On the land fruit trees are grown. Harvested products together with dairy are sold at the local markets. The family gets small monthly income from agriculture, but it is rarely enough to cover their monthly expenses.

Tariel requested loan from Credo to start a family business. Tariel has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. 

With his credit Tariel will purchase a car. He will drive it as a taxi himself. Tariel is a very hardworking man. He wants to improve his family's living conditions and for this he will work long hours. He will be driving local people and earning additional income for the family. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: To purchase a car to drive as a taxi.

loans.name: Elisabeth M R's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe a été crée depuis le cycle premier du banc villageois .
Il est composé de femmes vendeuses de poissons et viandes unies par de bonnes relations sociales.
Madame Élisabeth est la représentante. Elle est âgée de 47 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 2 enfants dont un garçon et une fille tous scolarisés. Avec son nouveau crédit de 500000 francs elle va se payer un nouveau réfrigérateur à 300000 francs trois paires de ciseaux à 50000 francs et acheter de la viande  150000 pour le revendre au détail.
Les bénéfices de son activité lui permettent de prendre en charge les dépenses quotidiennes de sa famille et de participer à la construction de la villa de son mari.
texts.en:
This group was created during the first cycle of the Banc Villageois.  It comprises women who sell fish and meat and who are united by strong social relationships.

Élisabeth is the group's representative.  She is 47 years old, married, and the mother of two children (a boy and a girl) who both go to school.  

With her new loan of 500,000 francs, she will spend 300,000 francs to purchase a new refrigerator, 50,000 francs to buy three pairs of scissors and 150,000 francs to buy meat that she will resell on a retail basis. 

The profits from her activity allow Élisabeth to take care of the daily expenses of her family and to contribute to the construction of her husband's house.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator to conserve meat.

loans.name: María Juana

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, por la gran cantidad de este fruto que había en aquella época, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Jesús De Nazaret.

En este lugar vive la señora María, tiene 65 años de edad, hace un año atrás falleció su querido esposo lo cual causo una gran tristeza pero fue superada por el amor y cuidado de sus cuatro hijos que ya son  mayores de edad y viven muy cerca, con ella vive un niño de 13 años el cual lo crio desde pequeño y que junto a su marido reconocieron como hijo, el  estudia en colegio.

Doña María con la finalidad de contar con sus propios ingresos y con esto salir adelante se dedica a la venta de productos naturales y cosméticos de Avon y  Yanbal (artículos de belleza, cosméticos perfumería y accesorios para damas). Su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, trabaja todos los días ya que tiene muchos clientes que siempre le compran sus productos sobretodo los productos naturales que es lo mas vende ya que son muy buenos, da facilidades de pago ya que deja a crédito y cobra cada quince días. 

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar productos naturales y cosméticos. Está en el Banco Comunal desde el inicio  y le gusta por la ayuda que le han dado en los momentos difíciles de su vida. 

Su sueño es que su hijo menor termine sus estudios.
texts.en:
The members of Banco Comunal de Jesús De Nazaret [Jesus of Nazareth Communal Bank] meet every 15 days in the city of Portoviejo, capital of Manabí. The city has been known for many years as the City of Real Tamarinds because of the large quantity of tamarind fruit that grows there.

This is where 65-year-old María lives. One year ago, her dear husband died. This gave her great sadness, but she overcame it through the love and care of her four children, who are all adults now and live nearby. With her lives a 13-year-old boy, whom she has raised since he was small and whom she and her husband saw as their own son. He studies in school now. 

In order to have her own income and move forward, María makes her living selling natural and cosmetic products from Avon and Yanbal (beauty items, cosmetics, perfumes, and ladies' accessories). Her sales style is door-to-door and she works everyday because she has many customers who are always buying her products. Her customers buy her natural products more than the rest, so she sells those the most, since they are very good products. 

She will use this loan to buy natural and cosmetic products. She has been in the Banco Comunal since it began and she likes it for the help it has given her in difficult moments in her life. 

Her dream is for her youngest son to finish his studies.

loans.use: to buy natural and cosmetic products.

loans.name: Geraldine

texts.en:
Geraldine, 41, is a married woman with three children, who are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Geraldine raises pigs in the Philippines. Geraldine has been in this business for 12 years.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. Geraldine requested a PHP 25,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

In the future, Geraldine would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Lea

texts.en:
Lea is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines. Lea has been in this business for 2 years now. She works hard to support her family. 

Lea requested a PHP 13,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. to buy ingredients for her food production business.

In the future, Lea would like to save money so she can continue sending her children to school.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Givi

texts.en:
Givi is 56 years old. He lives in the Gori district with his 54-year-old wife, Manana, and their 19-year-old son, George. Manana is working as a teacher. She gives private lessons from her house. George is working as an artisan on house renovations and construction for private order. They both earn small monthly salaries.
 
Givi has requested loans from local financial institutions several times for family business start-ups, but without any success. His loan requests were rejected all the time because of his low income and the family’s poor living conditions.
 
Givi requested a loan from Credo to start-up a family business. Givi has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. 

With his credit, Givi will open a car washing center. He will build a place and purchase all the needed washing equipment. Givi is a very hardworking man. He wants to start a new business, where he will work himself. Givi will work hard and long hours and try to earn a good profit from his new business. With the increased income, he will be able to provide a better life for his loved ones.

loans.use: To open a car washing center.

loans.name: Aida De La Concepcion

texts.es:
Aida es una mujer dedicada a la enseñanza, ya que su profesión es  maestra de educación primaria,  con 21 años  de desempeñarse como docente, es casada,  con 3 personas a su cargo, a quienes les da todo el apoyo para su desarrollo 

actualmente tiene una necesidad de mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda  y reparación  de cuartos, por eso visito a ceprodel para ser beneficiada con un financiamiento el que utilizaría en la compra de perlines, zinc, puertas y mano de obra, la que le brindara mejores condiciones en su vivienda.
texts.en:
Aida is a woman who is devoted to teaching, as she is an elementary school teacher.  She's worked as a teacher for 21 years.  She is married, with 3 dependents in her care.  She gives her all to provide them with the support they need for their development.

At this time, she needs to improve the condition of her house and make repairs to some rooms.  She visited CEPRODEL so that she could take advantage of a loan that she will use to buy beams, sheets of corrugated metal, doors, and labor, thereby providing better living conditions in her home.

loans.use: to buy beams, sheets of corrugated metal, doors, and labor to build rooms

loans.name: Mariano

texts.es:
Mariano  es un hombre soltero  de 25 años de edad, vive junto a su pareja  en el  Caserío Chuarixché, Cantón el Tablón  Sololá, Sololá. 
El es un hombre agricultor que trabaja fuerte para mantener a su familia. Actualmente cultiva  papa,  en una parcela que  se encuentra ubicada en el lugar donde vive.
Este trabajo lo aprendió de sus padres hace muchos años la cual fue el primer trabajo de su vida, de esta manera es como el obtiene ingresos aceptables que lo ayudan a contribuir con el sustento familiar.
El ahora tiene 10 años de experiencia realizando este tipo de trabajo por lo que ve la necesidad de solicitar un préstamo de Q 3,500.00 para comprar semillas de papa y abono orgánico ya que por la temporada del año la cosecha es mejor. Esto ara que cultive mas en otras parcelas expandiendo su verdura.
Su sueño es construir su casa para mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia,  ya que por el momento vive aun con sus padres.
texts.en:
Mariano is single and 25. He lives with his partner in Caserío Chuarixché in Tablón canton in Sololá, Sololá. He works hard as a farmer to support his family. He grows potatoes on a plot close to the house where he lives. Farming, which he learned from his parents many years ago, was his first job and has allowed him to earn enough money to help pay household expenses.

He has 10 years of agricultural experience and now needs a loan of Q 3,500 to buy potato seed and organic fertilizer for the best harvest season of the year and to plow other sections to plant more vegetables. He dreams of building a house to improve his family's standard of living, as they still live with his parents.

loans.use: to buy potato seed and organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Ronaldo

texts.en:
Ronaldo, 43 years of age, is married to a private employee and they are blessed with three children. 

He has owned and operated a motorcycle transport for almost 15 years. With this business, he's earning a net income of PHP 300 daily. 

Ronaldo is asking for a loan amounting to PHP 10,000 to pay for the repairs and maintenance of his motorcycle. He's hoping that his requested loan will be granted so that he can improve his business and make it more profitable.

loans.use: To pay for the repairs and maintenance of his motorcycle.

loans.name: Beglar

texts.en:
Beglar, 32, is married and lives in the Batumi district with his wife, his mother and his two daughters (2 and 7 years old). 

Beglar has requested loans from local financial institutions several times for family business start-ups, but without any success. His loan requests were rejected all the time because of his low income and the family’s poor living conditions.
 
The only source of living for the family is Beglar’s monthly salary. He is working at the electric company.
 
Beglar requested a loan from Credo to start a family business. Beglar has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. 

With his credit, Beglar will open a bakery. He will rent a commercial space and purchase all the needed materials. His wife and his mother will be working as bakers in order to decrease the expenses and increase the profit. The bakery that Beglar is going to rent is in a very populous area and he hopes it will help the business to be successful. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will give Beglar an opportunity to earn additional income for the family and significantly improve their living conditions.

loans.use: To open a bakery.

loans.name: Winfrida

texts.en:
Winfrida is a married business lady and a mother of one. She owns a retail shop in Malindi, where she also resides. Selling small items like sugar and flour in a retail shop has been her core activity for the last three years. 

She says that the challenge of the business has been customers buying on credit and not repaying in good time. Competition is also a factor. 

She knew Milango through friends who invited her to join in. She now seeks a loan to buy sugar, rice and cooking oil for resale. She has an ambition to be running a big retail shop in the next five years.

loans.use: to buy sugar, rice and cooking oil.

loans.name: Kenia Andrea

texts.es:
La Señora Kenia, es una mujer abnegada responsable en su núcleo familiar, trabajando como docente de educación primaria en un colegio de la localidad donde vive, ha sacado adelante a su familia, es Madre soltera  con un  hijo a su cargo,   

actualmente está solicitando  un financiamiento a ceprodel que utilizara para la compra de materiales de construcción como hierro, piedrín, cemento, zinc y mano de obra,  y de esa manera crearle mejores  condiciones al ceno familiar, el que agradece por lo oportuno del crédito y a los inversionistas por el apoyo  a estos sectores tan necesitados que de no ser así no se abrieran nuevos caminos en la vida.
texts.en:
Kenia is an undeniably responsible family member. She has supported her family by working as an elementary school teacher at a local school. She is a single mother and has one dependent son. 

She has applied to Ceprodel for a loan, which she will use to buy iron, stone, cement, and zinc and to pay workers so that her family can live in better surroundings. She is grateful for this chance and thanks the lenders for supporting these needy sectors that, without such help, would not be able to follow new paths in life.

loans.use: to buy iron, stone, cement, and zinc and to pay workers to build a room.

loans.name: Ekaterine

texts.en:
Ekaterine is 52 years old. She lives in the capital city of Georgia, Tbilisi with her husband, three children, son-in-law and two infant grandchildren. Ekaterine requested loans from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. Her loan requests were rejected every time because of her low income and the family's poor living conditions.

Ekaterine and her two children are working at the local factory on small monthly salaries. Her husband is an artisan and also works on a salary.

Ekaterine requested loan from Credo to start-up family business. Ekaterine has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as "high risk borrowers" because of their low income. 

With her credit Ekaterine will start trading in clothes from Turkey. She will go there to purchase products at the wholesale price, bring them to the capital city, and sell among the neighbors with a price markup. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will give Ekaterine an opportunity to earn an additional income for the family to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: To start trading in clothes from Turkey

loans.name: Levan

texts.en:
Levan is 44 years old. He lives in the Batumi District with his wife, a 13-year-old son and a 15-year-old daughter. 

Levan has requested loans from local financial institutions several times for family business start-ups, but without any success. His loan requests were rejected all the time because of his low income and the family’s poor living conditions.
 
The family has no source of income at the moment.

Levan requested a loan from Credo to start a family business. Levan has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. 

With his credit, Levan will purchase a mini-bus. He will start driving it on a bus line and earn a small income for the family. Levan is a very hard working man. He will try his best to earn a good profit and ensure a better life for his family.

loans.use: To purchase a mini-bus to drive on a bus line.

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.fr: jacqueline est une camerounaise de 45 ans, mariée et mère de quatre enfants tous allant à l'école. elle gère un mini boutique de moulins à maïs dans un quartier de la ville depuis 03 ans. elle sollicite ce crédit pour acheter une nouvelle machine a écraser afin de satisfaire toute sa clientèle et engranger plus de bénéfices.les bénéfices générés vont etre injecter dans l'activité pour augmenter son capital et son activité d'une part et d'autre part de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille (éducation, nutrition, santé)
texts.en:
Jacqueline is a 45-year-old woman from Cameroon.  She is married and the mother of four children who all go to school.  

For the past three years she has been running a small maize-grinding shop in one of the neighborhoods of her city.  She is requesting this loan to buy a new grinding machine in order to meet the needs of all her customers and to increase her profits.

Part of her profits will be reinvested in her activity in order to increase her capital and business.  The rest will be used to meet her family's needs (education, nutrition and healthcare).

loans.use: to buy a maize-grinding machine.

loans.name: Akbar

texts.en:
Thirty-four-year-old Akbar is married and lives in the Gardabani district, Jandara village with his wife Tanara. Akbar requested loans from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan requests were rejected every time because of his low income and the family's poor living conditions.

Akbar has a tractor. He is working locally on a monthly salary. The family is renting a plot of agricultural land, where broom trees are grown. From these trees the family is making brooms and selling them at the local markets.

Akbar requested a loan from Credo to start up a family business. Akbar has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as "high risk borrowers" because of their low income. 

With his credit Akbar will purchase calves. He will raise the calves and sell them at a higher price to earn an additional income for the family. Akbar is a very hardworking man. He wants to expand his agriculture and for this he will reinvest part of the profit in the same field. Another part Akbar will use for improving the family's living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase calves

loans.name: Naile

texts.en:
Naile is 42 years old. She lives in the Gardabani District with her retired mother, brother, neices, nephew and his wife. Naile requested loans from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. Her loan requests were rejected every time because of her low income and the family's poor living conditions.

The only source of the income for the family is from agriculture. They have rented a plot of land where broom trees are grown. With the harvested product the family makes brooms and sells them at local markets. Naile requested loan from Credo to start up a family business. Naile has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as "high risk borrowers" because of their low income. 

With her credit Naile will start trading with brooms. As Gardabani district is well known for broom trees, and the brooms are sold very cheap there, Naile will purchase stocks of brooms and sell them with a price markup in Batumi district. She will earn a good profit and will be able to reinvest part of it in the same field. Another part Naile will use for improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To start trading in brooms

loans.name: Jose

texts.es:
José Luís trabaja como instalador de energía eléctrica en diferentes lugares de El alto, por las noches esta estudiando para capacitarse mas en su fuente laboral. Vive en casa de sus padres en la zona de Rió Seco de la Ciudad de El Alto.

Necesita crédito para comprar herramientas nuevas y de buena calidad de esta manera pobra mejorar sus ingresos económicos y mejorar su calidad de vida.

El sueño de José Luís, es llegar a ser profesional en su fuente laboral.

Es la primera vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
José Luís installs electricity lines in El Alto and takes additional training courses in his field at night. He lives in his parent's house in the Rió Seco neighborhood in the city of El Alto.

He needs a loan to buy new, high-quality tools so that he can increase his income and his standard of living. José Luís wants to become a professional in his field. This is his first loan cycle with IMPRO and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy new tools.

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es:
Jorge Jacinto trabaja como empleado de la empresa publica de textil, vive con sus tres hijos, en casa de sus familiares como cuidadores en la zona de Rió Seco de la Ciudad de El Alto.

El crédito es para comprar material de construcción: cemento, ladrillos, etc. Así podrá  refaccionar su vivienda y de esta manera mejorar su calidad de vida

El sueño de Jorge Jacinto, es de tener su casa propia.

Es la segunda vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en: Jorge Jacinto works for a public textile company. He lives with his three children in his relatives' house in the Rió Seco neighborhood of the city of El Alto. He will use the loan to buy building materials such as cement and bricks to renovate his house and improve his standard of living. Jorge Jacinto dreams of owning his own home. This is his second loan cycle with IMPRO and the first with Kiva.

loans.use: to buy building materials to renovate his house.

loans.name: Amélé

texts.fr: Jeune dame de 32ans, Amélé vit avec son conjoint et leurs enfants à Lomé. Elle espère assurer un avenir meilleur à sa famille et la pérennité de son activité grâce au profit tiré de son activité (vente de charbons de bois).Le troisième  prêt sollicité à WAGES permettra à la dame de s’approvisionner en marchandise afin d'atteindre ses objectifs.
texts.en: Amélé, aged 32, is a young woman who lives with her husband and her children in Lomé.  She hopes that the profits from her charcoal sales business will help her to provide a better future for her family and allow her to continue her business.  She will use this third loan from WAGES to buy more charcoal in order to reach her goals.

loans.use: to buy bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Ivane

texts.en:
Twenty-five-year-old Ivane lives in Akhmeta Kheltubani village, of the Gori district, with his retired father, mother, 24-year-old brother and sister-in-law. Ivane requested loans from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan requests were rejected every time because of his low income and the family's poor living conditions.

Ivane is working as an artisan at the local road building company. His family has three milk cows and they also own plot of land, where apple trees and garlic are grown. The cows are milked every day to produce cheese. The harvested products and cheese are sold at the local market.

Ivane requested a loan from Credo to start up a family business. Ivane has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as "high risk borrowers" because of their low income. 

With his credit Ivane will purchase a mini-bus. He will start trading in fruits and vegetables. Ivane will purchase products at wholesale prices from the local market and resell them among the villagers with a price markup to earn a good profit. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: To purchase a mini-bus and start trading in fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Samson

texts.fr: Afin d’agrandir son secteur d’activité et de se lancer dans la vie maritale, Samson un jeune homme de 32ans sollicite l’aide de WAGES par un premier prêt pour s’approvisionner en marchandises (des pièces détachées).  il a démarré en 2000 et exerce l'activité dans une boutique.
texts.en: Samson, aged 32, is requesting a first loan from WAGES in order to buy some merchandise (spare parts).  His goals are to increase his activity and to get married.  He started in this business in 2000 and he works in a shop.

loans.use: to buy spare parts.

loans.name: Khalida

texts.en:
Khalida is a 42 year-old married woman and the mother of seven.  She is a hard-working mother who is helping her family by providing tailoring services in her community. She has been doing this for the past five years. 

Khalida knows the techniques of stitching very well. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns enough to lead a decent life. To help her continue operations of her business, she has requested  a loan of Rs.45,000  to buy thread in different colors along with  packs of zippers and buttons to meet up with increasing demand. In addition to repaying the loan, she will use part of the revenues to deal with personal expenses.

loans.use: to buy thread in different colors along with packs of zippers and buttons.

loans.name: Rizwana

texts.en:
Rizwana is a 28-year-old married woman who has been running a milk-selling business for three years. She has three buffaloes whose milk she sells to many of their neighbors. 

Her husband is a laborer and his income is too low to support the needs of the family members.  Rizwana is the best-earning resource in her household. She is a mother of seven children. She needs to earn much more to meet their everyday expenditures including food, clothing and education. In order to make larger profits, she has requested a loan of Rs 35,000 to buy one more buffalo to cater to more customers. She hopes to increase her milk-production capacity, which ultimately will help generate more cash.

loans.use: to buy one more buffalo

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou, 43, is married with five children, three of them in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.
 
Marilou has a fishing business in the Philippines and has been in this business for five years. She has requested a loan of 12,000 Philippine pesos through the Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation. She will use the loan to buy fishing gear and other equipment for her business.

In the future, Marilou would like to save money so that she can continue sending her children to school.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment for her business

loans.name: Samina

texts.en:
Samina had a difficult time after her husband’s business failure. So she decided to work with her husband to support her family for a better future. 

Ten years ago, she began stitching work in her house. She stitches for people living around her house and uses the income to support her entire family. 

Due to a lack of funds, she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. So she has borrowed 25,000 Pakistani rupees from the Kashf Foundation. 

She intends to use the loan to buy raw materials for her business, including cloth, threads in different colours, lace and zippers. This investment will help her stitch more dresses on time, which will help her generate more revenue.

loans.use: to buy cloth, threads in different colours, lace and zippers.

loans.name: Ma. Mardy

texts.en:
Ma. Mardy is 43 years old and has five children. She is married and has four children who are in school.

Ma. Mardy is in the agricultural business of raising livestock in the Philippines. Ma. Mardy requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more livestock to raise and sell. She has been raising livestock for 13 years now, and has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Ma. Mardy would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more livestock to raise and sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy an oven.

loans.name: Elma

texts.en: Elma is a 49-year-old married woman and a mother of four grown children from Baclayon, Bohol, Philippines. Elma has been running a toilet bowl making business with her husband for several years now. This is the source of their income. Elma is asking for a loan to buy cement, sand, gravel, steel bars and other materials for making toilet bowls. With this loan, Elma and her husband will be able to make and produce more toilet bowls to sell.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, gravel, steel bars and other materials for making toilet bowls.

loans.name: Estela

texts.en:
Estela is a married woman and a mother of eight children from Baclayon, Bohol. Estela has been engaged in a fishing business together with her husband for more than 10 years now. This is the source of their income.

Estela is asking for a loan to buy fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and other items for her business. With this loan, her husband will be able to improve his catch, thus giving them more fish to sell in the market. Estela dreams of making their business successful and sustainable.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and other items for her business.

loans.name: Marfe

texts.en:
Marfe is 35 years old. She is married and has three children who are in school.

Marfe is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. Marfe has requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feed and other supplies for her livestock.

Marfe has been raising livestock for 4 years now, and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

Marfe would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase feed and other supplies for her livestock.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase talcum powder, lotion, perfumes, lipstick and body spray.

loans.name: Faiz

texts.en: Faiz is a 30 year-old married woman who has had a business of selling milk for many years. She has 2 buffaloes and 1 milk cow; she sells milk to many of her neighbors, along with butter that she makes from the milk. Her business is good enough to provide her with a decent life. She is a mother of seven and is very motivated to provide them a beautiful life with good education, food and clothing.  She has improved her business to meet the day-to-day expenses of life. She has some past savings and has requested a loan of Rs 20,000 to purchase one more cow and feed for its calves. She hopes increase her earnings through improved sales.

loans.use: to purchase one more cow and feed for its calves.

loans.name: Nazeran

texts.en: Nazeran, age 46, is involved in the business of animal sales and purchase.  She is very experienced in her business as she has been doing it for the past 10 years. She earns a good amount of income through her business to lead a decent life. She is the mother of five children and is trying hard to fulfill their demands, including food, health, clothing, and education. She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation.  Currently she has requested a loan of Rs. 35,000. It will help her to purchase two more goats and sheep. She is in her 3rd loan cycle with a good repayment history. Her objective is to expand the business and save enough for her family's future with the increased revenues.

loans.use: to purchase two more goats and sheep.

loans.name: James

texts.en: James is 32 years old and in the transport sector. He is married to Jane, a businesswoman. They are blessed with one child. James has been in the transport sector for the past three years. He has a monthly income of 40000 KES, which he uses to support his family. James is applying for his third loan term with KADET. James will use the loan to buy a new motorcycle. With the expected profit from the business he will provide for his family. His hopes and dreams are to have a sustainable and profitable business.

loans.use: to buy a new motorcycle.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is a 59-year-old quarry miner. He is married to Ismail, a farmer. They are blessed with four children. He has been mining in a quarry for the past ten years. He has a monthly income of 15,000 KES, which he uses to provide for his children and wife. Peter is applying for his sixth loan term with KADET. Peter will use the loan to buy a quarry machine. With the anticipated profit from the business he will expand his quarry. His hopes and dreams are to provide for his family.

loans.use: to buy a quarry machine.

loans.name: Yesenia Dominga

texts.es: Yesenia es una joven señora  preocupada por la salud de los demás, es licenciada en enfermería, labora en un centro de salud de la localidad También ejerce la actividad  comercial como es   pulpería y también  venta de ropa y cosmético  tiene 7 años de dedicarse a esta actividad con solo su negocio y los ingresos de  esposo que se desempeña como docente están preparando académicamente a sus hijos que tienen a su cargo. Actualmente está presentando la necesidad   de surtir  su pulpería y satisfacer y  cubrir la demanda de sus clientes. Por  eso se presento a ceprodel para solicitar  un financiamiento que lo utilizara  para la compra de frijoles, azúcar, aceite, arroz, semolina, pollo, huevo, surtir pulpería  de esa manera mejorar las condiciones.
texts.en:
Yesenia is a young woman who is concerned about the health of others.  She has a nursing degree, and she works at a health center in the area.  She also has a grocery store, and she has been selling clothes and cosmetics for seven years.  With just her business and her husband’s income from working as a teacher, they are academically preparing their children, who are under their care.

She currently needs to stock her store and meet her customers’ demand.  That is why she came to Ceprodel in order to request a loan.  She will use the loan to buy beans, sugar, cooking oil, rice, semolina, chicken, and eggs in order to stock her grocery store.  This way she will improve the conditions.

loans.use: to buy beans, sugar, cooking oil, rice, semolina, chicken, and eggs to increase her inventory.

loans.name: Samir

texts.en:
Samir is 31 years old and married with two  children. He is an IDP (internally displaced person) and lives with his wife and children   in the Bilasuvar IDP Settlement. He is a Fuzuli refugee.  For past four years he has been raising sheep because mutton is in high demand in this region. Samir is a retired person with an income of 100 AZN monthly from this business. This is a very profitable business and Samir  is doing it together with his wife.

He is keeping a flock of sheep in his own yard. He fattens them and takes their meat to the central bazaar, where butchers and customers purchase from him. People use mutton for traditional dishes like kababs, dolmas, pilovs, etc.

He has taken out a loan from Aqroinvest before and has a good loan history. This is going to be his fifth loan. This time he requires 2000 AZN in order to purchase 12 sheep in order to sell more meat in summer. He is optimistic about this loan, because in summer more people consume meat, due to the holidays and increased customers in restaurants.  He appreciates your support

loans.use: to buy 12 sheep

loans.name: Alejandra De La Concepcion

texts.es: La señora Alejandra es una mujer visionaria y esforzada que siempre está enfocada al mejoramiento del nivel de vida, trabaja en un centro  de educación  Pre-escolar, donde habita, desempeñándose como Docente con 29 años de laborar, es soltera con 1 persona  a su cargo , esta señora actualmente presenta una necesidad de mejorar su vivienda, por eso visito a ceprodel para solicitar financiamiento para utilizarlo en la compra de materiales de construcción como: ladrillo, zinc, hierro y arena para mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda en techo y pared, de esa manera crear  mejores condiciones para  su familia.
texts.en: Alejandra is a hardworking, visionary woman, focused on improving her quality of life.  She works as a teacher at the pre-school center, and has been doing this for 29 years.  She is single, has one dependent, and needs to make improvements to her house.  She came to CEPRODEL to request a loan so she can buy building materials such as bricks, zinc metal sheeting, iron bars, and sand in order to make improvements to the walls and roof of her house.  This will create better conditions for her family.

loans.use: to buy building materials.

loans.name: Andranik

texts.en:
Andranik lives with her wife and son in the small village Chiva of Vayots Dzor region. He is a teacher with many years of experience teaching at a local school. As a teacher's salary is hardly enough for covering the family's basic needs, Andranik started his agricultural business three years ago. Currently, he keeps on his farm two cows, two calves and 18 chickens.

Andranik also owns agricultural land, where he grows apple, peach, nut, apricot and pear trees.  Andranik's wife helps him with running the farm. She milks cows, uses the milk in cheese production and Andranik sells these agricultural products locally.  Realizing that income from farming is very important for sustaining the family, Andranik would like to enlarge it. So Andranik has applied for this loan to increase his livestock with one more calf. This will help him to gather more milk and increase the sales of agricultural products. Andranik waits for your support.

loans.use: to pay for a calf

loans.name: Aleksandre

texts.en:
Thirty-nine year-old Aleksandre lives in Akhaltsikhe district with his 34 year-old wife and six year-old son. Aleksandre requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected all the time, because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. Aleksandre has a shop. He sells detergents and hygiene products. Aleksandre is purchasing everything at the wholesale price and sells with the price mark up to earn a small monthly income, which is the only source of living for the family.

Aleksandre requested a loan from Credo to start-up a family business. Aleksandre has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. With his credit Aleksandre will increase the stock of products for his shop. He wants to have more varieties of detergents and hygiene products to offer better choice to his clients. His shop is already well known among the villagers and with the increased varieties of products he will attract even more customers. Aleksandre will try his best to increase the family income, in order to provide a better life for his wife and son.  The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva Start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: To increase the stock of products for his shop

loans.name: Clarina

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Clarina works hard to support her family.

She has a business buying and selling ready-to-wear in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from prepaid mobile loading. Clarina is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to purchase more stock of ready-to-wear to sell for her business.

Clarina has been sustaining her business activities through her past 17 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of ready-to-wear clothing to sell

loans.name: Victorina

texts.en:
Victorina is 52 years old and married with two children. With one child currently in school, Victorina works very hard to provide for them.

Victorina runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

Victorina has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items such as shampoo, coffee, sugar, canned goods, candies, etc. 

Victorina would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Lezel

texts.en:
Lezel is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to purchase additional fishing net and other fishing equipment for her fishing business.

Lezel has been in this business for three years. Lezel earns more income from her general store.

Lezel has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing net and other fishing equipment for her business

loans.name: Kong

texts.en:
Residing in the Batie district of Takeo province, Kong is 64 years old and she is married with five children. She earns a living through farming rice in the local area. Having been in this business for 35 years, Kong is able to earn about US$6 per day and she manages to save about US$3 each day after daily expenses. 

Kong has never been with Kiva's partner, VisionFund, before. Now, she is applying as the first-time borrower with VisionFund to cover the entire tuition fees for her daughter to study Information Technology at a local university. She hopes this loan will enable her daughter to keep studying until graduation in order to get a good job so as to support them and improve the family's living standard.

loans.use: To cover the entire tuition fees for her daughter

loans.name: Timoth

texts.en: Timoth is a father of three children, all of whom go to school in the nearby public school. He runs a transport business that involves transporting people on motorbikes. This has been his core activity for the last three years. The 32 year-old husband has ambitions of making life for his family better. He wants the best education for his children as they grow older. He is seeking a loan to buy school uniforms and some items for home use.  The challenges that he faces in his business include unpredictable weather changes and competition for customer from other motorbike operators. He wants his business to grow so that he may diversify the income he raises from it.

loans.use: to buy school uniforms.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is 48 years old and has six children. Norma is married and has one child who is in school.
