Jean Caryl is borrowing 12,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase more goods to sell in her general store.

Jean Caryl has been sustaining her business activities through her past 4 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more goods to sell in her general store

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 66 years old, the widowed mother of five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Virginia has a general store business in the Philippines. Virginia has been in this business for 20 years.

Virginia requested a PHP 16,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

 In the future, Virginia would like to build and expand her business in order to support the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Turab

texts.en:
Turab is 44 years old, married, and has five children,  two sons and three daughters. He is an IDP (internally displaced person) from Fizuli city. He is an  ex-serviceman from Karabakh. 

Turab lives in the Baku region with his family. His wife stays at home, so he is the only one earning an income. His daughters are married and his sons go to university. 

Turab started his taxi business eight years ago. Now he needs a loan of 2,000 AZN to buy tires for the cars. He wants to use the profits for his sons' future. 

In the future, Turab wants to buy a new car. This will be more profitable for his business. Turab is thankful to Komak and Kiva for supporting him.

loans.use: to buy tires for his cars.

loans.name: Annaliza

texts.en:
Annaliza is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a bakery business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 10 years. She earns more income from food vending. She is borrowing PHP 22,000 through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients for her bakery business.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she could afford to send her children to school in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients for her bakery business.

loans.name: Carmencita

texts.en:
Carmencita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

She is borrowing PHP 19,500 through NWTF to buy fishing gear and other equipment. NWTF is re-listing Carmencita's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fishing gear and equipment.

loans.name: Chantha

texts.en:
A young mother in early 20s, Chantha is a villager from Kampong Cham province and a mother of two children. 

Her main source of income is from selling children’s toys and working for others for a fee as extra income. She is able to earn up to 27,000 KHR per day from the current business that she has had for several years. 

Chantha has never joined with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) before. As the first time borrower, she is seeking a loan of 2,000,000 KHR in order to buy more children’s toys for resale. She hopes that she can make more income from her business.

loans.use: To buy more children's toys for resale.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Sokleng's Group

texts.en:
Sokleng, in her early 30s, is a mother of three schoolchildren and resides in the Dambae district of Kampong Cham province.  For her, two hectares of cassava farming are her main source of income. To supplement the family’s income, her husband also works for others for a fee. She has been farming for five years and it has returned her about 20,500 KHR per day. 

This is not the first loan for Sokleng with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). After she repaid back her past loan, she feels empowered that she can relieve her family burden better than before. She formed a group of two as the leader.  She is seeking 1,200,000 KHR while her co-borrower is applying for 1,400,000 KHR. As a group leader, she will spend her loan portion to plow her farmland, to buy potash, and to pay labor costs. She hopes that she can make more income from her agribusiness to improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: To plow her farmland, to buy potash, and to pay labor costs.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Lilia works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell livestock business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from buying and selling vegetables. Lilia is borrowing PHP 20000 through NWTF to purchase additional livestock to sell through her livestock business.

Lilia has been sustaining her business activities through the past 7 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock to sell

loans.name: Ma. Elena

texts.en:
Ma. Elena is 40 years old and married with five children. She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. She has been farming rice for 5 years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers, insecticides, pesticides and other farm supplies. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, insecticides, pesticides and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Legora

texts.en:
Legora is 52 years old and married with three children. She earns a living by raising livestock in the Philippines. She has been raising livestock for 4 years and also earns additional income from buying and selling vegetables.

She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase additional livestock and other supplies for her business. Legora is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock and other supplies for her business.

loans.name: Iy's Group

texts.en:
Originally from Kampong Cham province, Iy is 48 years old and a married mother of four children. For 20 years, she has overcome her family's hardship via rice farming and working for others for a fee. The current business has returned her about 28,800 KHR per day. 

Iy, who has been with Vision Fund (Kiva’s partner) for two cycles, has repaid her past loan successfully. It has enabled her to improve her living conditions. Moreover, she can afford to buy more household appliances for her family as well. 

Now, she leads a group consisting of two female members to apply for a new loan. Her loan portion is 1,200,000 KHR while 500,000 KHR is her joint member's requesting loan amount. She will spend this loan to buy fertilizer and rice seed, and to pay transplanting fees. She hopes that she can gain a high yield with better profits than before.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and rice seed, and to pay transplanting fees.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Asima's Group

texts.en:
Asima is the group leader of this group. She is 37 years old and a mother of four children. She is a very decent and honest lady. Her husband owns a small tea restaurant which is the only source of income for his family. He wants to buy new crockery, but due to insufficient savings he finds it difficult.  

Therefore, his wife Asima, as a member of a two-person lending group, has requested a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan, to purchase crockery for her husband's restaurant. She hopes for the success of her husband's business and her children's education. She says thanks to Kiva lenders and the BRAC staff.

loans.use: To purchase crockery for her husband's restaurant.

loans.name: Melisa

texts.en:
Melisa, 32 years of age, is married to a farmer and they are blessed with 1 infant child. She has been into a vegetable vending business for almost 1 year, and with this business she's earning a net income of about Php 200 daily. 

She is requesting a loan amounting to Php 10,000 to purchase string beans, squash and eggplant to sell. She also wants to buy some hogs to raise to have an additional source of income. She's hoping that her requested loan will be granted so that she can earn more income to improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: To purchase string beans, squash and eggplant to sell.

loans.name: Ma. Chita

texts.en: Ma. Chita is 45 years old.  She is married and has five children. She earns a living by pig fattening in the Philippines. Ma. Chita is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.  Ma. Chita has been pig fattening for three years and also earns additional income from a general store.  She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Errol

texts.es: Errol, está casado, tiene la edad de 43 años y vive con su esposa e hijos que son su mayor prioridad. El con el crédito va comprar los insumos para la asistencia de su plantación, el comprara abonos, plaguicidas y todo los productos de fumigación. El cuenta con un terreno ya en producción desde varios años atrás y actualmente necesita mejorarla para así poder obtener de esta el máximo rendimiento en producción. El tiene como meta generar más ingresos económicos para su bienestar familiar y tener un mejor futuro.   Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja
texts.en:
Errol's highest priority is the welfare of his family. He is 43, married, and lives with his wife and children. 

Errol will use these loan funds to purchase supplies to manage his coffee plantation: manure, pesticides, and fumigation products. Errol's land has produced coffee for several years, but he now needs to make investments in order to achieve maximum yields. Errol's goal is to generate higher income that will provide for his family and ensure a brighter figure. Errol has not borrowed from state-owned banks before. This is his first loan from FUDECOSUR, which has offered him a simpler application process and much lower interest rates.

loans.use: to manage his coffee plantation.

loans.name: Riziki

texts.en:
Riziki, aged 31 years, is married and blessed with four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Riziki cooks food for sale at the market and sells to town dwellers and passersby. She cites seasonality being her major challenge in the business. She dreams of establishing a café business in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase food ingredients such as beans, rice, wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and cooking oil. She decided to join Yehu to access financial support to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase food ingredients such as beans, rice, wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and cooking oil.

loans.name: Nim's Group

texts.en: Residing in Kampong Cham province, Nim is 47 years old and a married mother of three kids. Currently, only one child still relies on her because the child is still in school. To tackle the family’s financial burden, she grows rice and cassava, while her husband works as a chef during wedding events.  She has been with this business since she was 26 years old. Now, she is able to earn up to 37,600 KHR per day. Nim is in her second cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). The good outcome of her loan has enabled her to increase the income to support her business, as well as to keep her child in school and set aside some money for saving. Now she leads a group of three to apply for a new loan. As the group leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer and to pay transplanting fees. She hopes that she can gain high income and keep her child in school up to the tertiary level.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and to pay for transplanting fee

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Van's Group

texts.en:
A mother of seven children residing in Kampong Cham province, Van is a 60-year-old farmer who does rice cropping and watermelon planting as her main income sources. She has been doing this business for 10 years, earning about 19,500 KHR per day. 

Including this new loan, she is a third-time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). After previous successful loan, which she has repaid completely, she feels confident that she can sustain her living condition in good shape. 

Now, in a group of four, she is the leader. The total amount of her group is requesting is 4,200,000 KHR, of which 1,400,000 KHR is her loan portion. She will use her loan portion to buy potash for her crops. She expects a good yield with a high selling price so that she can make more money to buy a plot of farmland to grow rubber trees for extra income.

loans.use: To buy potash for her crops.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
As a married mother of five children, Helen works hard to support her family. She has a fishing business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 22,000 through NWTF to buy a new engine for her fishing boat.

Helen has been sustaining her business activities through her past 11 loans from NWTF, and more recently through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy a new engine for her fishing boat.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn, 34, is married and has two children, who are in school.

Jocelyn is in the agricultural business, fattening pigs in the Philippines. Jocelyn has been in this business for five years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Jocelyn requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

In the future, Jocelyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Sony's Group

texts.en:
In her late 20s, Sony is married and the mother of two little children who are not ready for schooling yet. 

She makes a living via rainy season rice farming on a four-hectare area. The business, which she has been with for six years, has returned her about 12,700 KHR per day. 

Sony has been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for one cycle and has fully repaid her loan with success. Now, her living condition is getting better day by day.  

In a group of two, she is the leader. They are seeking the same loan amount of 500,000 KHR each. For Sony, her loan portion will be spent on fertilizer and gasoline purchasing to support her farmland. She will use the gasoline with a hand-tractor to plow her farmland. She hopes to gain a high yield and make a good profit.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and gasoline to support her farmland.

loans.name: Soeurn

texts.en:
Soeurn, a mother who is in her early 50s and has five children, is a citizen of Takeo province. Currently, she needs to support three kids who are still in school, two university students and one twelfth grader. To overcome her family's hardships, she sells beds. She has been involved with this business for just two years. 

She has never been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) before. Now, she is taking a loan in order to pay the university’s tuition fees for one of her sons, who is pursuing a bachelor's degree specializing in Management. Soeurn hopes that this loan will support the education costs of her child so that he can pay attention to getting a good academic record and obtaining a good job after graduation.

loans.use: To pay the university’s tuition fee for one of her sons.

loans.name: Riaz's Group

texts.en:
Riaz is a 39-year-old housewife. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a mother of three children. Her husband owns a fruit shop in the market, which is the only source of income for the family. He sells apples, bananas and oranges in his shop. 

Currently, he is interested to offer more variety to his customers, which will help him to increase his net income and savings as well. However, due to the lack of funds, he finds it difficult. Therefore, his wife, Riaz, as a member of a three-person lending group, has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan. She wants to help her husband to purchase a variety of fruits from the field and sell them in the market at a profitable price. With the profit, her husband wants to grow his business in the future. 

Riaz is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of fruits to sell.

loans.name: Clarita

texts.en:
This is Clarita. Her previous loan was a big help, not just in her business, but also in the education of her children as well as in their household expenditures. She has been in this business for 13 years now. She and her husband are working hard to provide for their everyday expenses.

She would like to apply for another 25,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add in her inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result for better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and children’s education expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Clarita dreams that her business will continue to be successful and hopes to have their own house and lot. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Belen

texts.en:
This is Belen, 50, resident of Intramuros, Manila, Philippines. She is married to Wilfredo, a vendor, and is a mother to her children. She and her husband manage their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses. 
                            
Belen operates a buy and sell business. What she basically does is buy different bags like sling bags, shoulder bags, backpacks, clutch bags and others. Customers are attracted to buy due to the low selling prices and the many options she offers. She also offers perfumes, bags and wallets in her store. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 2,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities and varieties of bags to expand her product inventory.

Belen dreams to be successful in her business and hopes that her children will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week. This is where she grows and finds strength from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for more quantities and varieties of bags to expand her product inventory.

loans.name: Ninfa

texts.en:
Ninfa is 42 years old and married with five children, three of whom are in school. Ninfa works very hard to provide for them.

Ninfa runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 26,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Ninfa has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items, such as snack foods, canned goods and other groceries. 

In the future Ninfa would like to save money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Kimhen's Group

texts.en:
Kimhen, 28, is a mother of three children, one of whom is in school. They live in Battambang province.  For her and the rest of her family, nine hectares of rice farming is the single business that she has had for six years. 

With VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), Kimhen is a third-time borrower, while her co-member is a first-cycle client. Kimhen has managed to upgrade her living in a gradual manner, which resulted from the positive outcomes of the loans that she has repaid completely. 

Now, she and her joint member are seeking 1,000,000 KHR each. As the group leader, she will spend her entire portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland. She expects that this purchase will return her a better yield than before.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farmland.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a food-vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 21,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase ingredients for her food production business.

Lucia has been in this business for 20 years. She earns more income from a general store.

Lucia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma, aged 54 years, is married and has six children, three of whom are still in school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.  For the past ten years, she has operated a coral reef selling business. She sells from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams to expand her business in the future.

With the loan, she wants to purchase bundles of coral reefs for resale. She joined Yehu to acquire loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of coral for resale.

loans.name: Juvelyn

texts.en:
Juvelyn, of Guingona, Ozamiz City, is a 41-year-old widow, with six children. 

To make a living, she plants corn, bananas, and vegetables in her tenanted land. She became a member of Gata Daku Multi-Purpose Cooperative (GDMPC) in 2009 and was able to gain access to microfinance services. 

Recently, Juvelyn borrowed a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy seedlings and fertilizer. She hopes to have an abundant harvest in order to support the needs of her children.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizer.

loans.name: Maricris

texts.en:
Maricris is 29 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Maricris is borrowing 29,500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy fertilizers, insecticides, pesticides and other farm supplies.

Maricris has been farming rice for 5 years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She has successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her rice farm and general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, insecticides, pesticides and other farm supplies

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam, aged 37 years, is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity, but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past ten years, selling household consumables, like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of high transportation costs. 

With the loan of KES 50,000, Mariam is requesting a loan to purchase stocks of sugar, rice, maize flour, and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance Trust to access loans, to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of sugar, rice, maize flour, and wheat flour.

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.es: La Sra. Beatriz sigue con la misma actividad de venta y elaboración de cigarros de chocolates artesanales este los elabora en su mismo domicilio los elabora con azúcar y esencias y  cuenta que le fue bien con el anterior crédito ya que lo utilizo en la compra de movilidad para la distribución de sus productos,   en esta ocasión solicita el crédito para la compra de Azúcar por mayor,  la Sra. Beatriz se siente feliz y agradecida por la oportunidad que le dan para crecer en su negocio.
texts.en: Beatriz continues to sell and make artisanal chocolate cigarettes. She makes them in her home with sugar and extracts. She says that things went very well for her with the previous loan because she used it to buy a vehicle for the distribution of her products. This time she is asking for the loan to buy sugar wholesale. Beatriz is happy and grateful for the opportunity given to her to grow her business.

loans.use: to buy quintals of sugar wholesale.

loans.name: Rodelia

texts.en:
Rodelia is 51 years old and married with nine children. Seven of her children are in school.

Rodelia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 16,000 Philippine Peso (PHP) loan through NWTF in order to purchase more items like biscuits, bread, soft-drinks and other miscellaneous items.

Rodelia has borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 2 years and also earns an income from tricycle transport.

Rodelia aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more items like biscuits, bread, soft drinks and other miscellaneous items.

loans.name: Mith's Group

texts.en: Mith is 42 years old and married. She has four children, two of whom are in school. She farms rice on two hectares of land. The current business has returned her about 20,000 Riels (KHR) per day. This is the first microloan for Mith with VisionFund (Kiva's partner). Both of them are seeking the same loan amount of 1,000,000 KHR each. Mith is the group leader, and will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer and insecticide for her crops. She hopes that she can boost her crop productivity and increase more profit.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and insecticide for her crops

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Ma.lorena

texts.en:
Ma.Lorena is 36 years old and married, with one child.

Ma.Lorena works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy additional items to sell in her general store, like snack foods, detergent soap, noodles, eggs, and sugar.

Ma.Lorena has borrowed and paid 11 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 20 years and also earns additional income from buying and selling piglets.

Ma. Lorena aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell in her general store, like snack foods, detergent soap, noodles, eggs, and sugar.

loans.name: Mwanaisha

texts.en:
Mwanaisha, 50, is a married woman with seven children, all of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that neither has electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a retail shop for the past ten years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business.

With the loan she is requesting she wants to purchase sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
Pedro tiene 46 años, está casado con Antonia con quien vive en su casa construida a base de adobe. Pedro se dedica a la agricultura y ha logrado convertir a sus terrenos agrícola en una buena fuente de ingreso para el y su esposa, actualmente prioriza la producción de cacao debido a la gran demanda que existe en su localidad y el buen precio que ofrecen los compradores por este productos.
Ya habiendo finalizado la temporada de cosecha, es muy necesario no dejar pasar el tiempo e iniciar con la compra de abono orgánico, almácigos, entre otros, además de contratar a trabajadores del lugar para la próxima cosecha. Este es su segundo préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecido por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. En esta ocasión desea contar con 4,000 nuevos soles para comprar abono orgánico y contratar trabajadores del lugar.
texts.en:
Pedro is 46 years old.  He is married to Antonia with whom he lives in his home built out of adobe.  Pedro makes a living in agriculture and he has managed to convert his farm lands into a good source of income for him and his wife.  Currently he is giving priority to the production of cacao due to the great demand that exists in his town and the good price that buyers offer for these products.  The harvest season having already ended, it is very necessary to not let time pass and to start with the purchase of organic fertilizer and seedlings, among other things, and also to hire local workers for the next harvest.  

This is his second loan with Kiva and he feels grateful for the financial support that he receives in order to move forward.  He is also committed to paying his installments in a punctual manner.  On this occasion he wants to have 4,000 nuevos soles (PEN) to buy organic fertilizer and to hire local workers.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer and to hire local workers.

loans.name: Prudencio

texts.es: Prudencio tiene 45 años, es padre soltero de dos hijos de 23 y 18 años de edad respectivamente, con quienes vive en su casa construida a base de adobe. Prudencio se dedica a la producción de cacao, gracias a este productos ha podido sacar adelante a sus hijos quienes en ocasiones también le ayudan a realizar su actividad laboral. En esta ocasión desea realizar el respectivo deshierbo y mantenimiento del caso , pues la época de cosecha ya finalizó y es momento de preparar el próximo cultivo de la mejor manera por está razón debe adquirir abono orgánico y contratar personal para sus cultivos. Prudencio espera adquirir más terrenos de cultivo para así expandir su producción pues considera que ese es su próximo gran reto. Este es su cuarto préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecido por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. En esta ocasión desea contar con 2,000 nuevos soles para la compra de abono orgánico.
texts.en:
Prudencio is 45 years old and is a single father with two sons aged 23 and 18. He lives with them in his house which is built from adobe bricks. Prudencio earns a living from cocoa production and through this he has been able to bring up his sons, who sometimes help him to carry out his work.

Currently he wants to carry out weed clearance and maintenance of the land. The harvest time has finished now and it is time to prepare well for the next crop. For this reason he needs to get organic fertilizer and employ staff to help with the cultivation. 

Prudencio hopes to buy more land for farming so he can increase his production as he thinks this is his next big challenge. This is his fourth loan with Kiva and he is grateful for the financial support he receives so he can get on in life. He is also committed to paying his instalments punctually. On this occasion he is asking for 2000 soles to buy organic fertilizer.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 61 years old and married, with three children, one of whom is in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Virginia runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 23,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase additional groceries to sell.

Virginia has been in this business for ten years, selling a variety of items, such as sugar, soap, noodles, and other groceries. 

In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell.

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en:
Roselyn is 32 years old and married with five children.

Roselyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been running the general store for six years and also earns an income from rice retailing.

She requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like soap, sugar, shampoo, canned goods, chips, etc.

Roselyn has borrowed and paid 19 loans from NWTF before this loan. 

She aspires to save enough money so she can send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like soap, sugar, shampoo, canned goods, chips, etc.

loans.name: Kinene

texts.en:
Kinene is a married man, 30 years old, with one child. He is a businessman who deals in selling agricultural produce, such as coffee, maize, beans, and other cereals. He says he works six days a week. He is also engaged in agriculture, an activity he does extensively. He has gardens of coffee and a banana plantation. 

Kinene has been in the produce and agriculture business since 2001 and, through it, he has been able to build a permanent house and acquire a piece of cultivable land in his home area.

He says that the reason why he started this business is to take care of his financial needs. He acquired this loan to buy and stock more produce since it is coffee season.
 
Kinene says that his main clients are from the surrounding area. He faces a challenge of bad debtors. He describes himself as a hard-working and honest man.

loans.use: to buy coffee to sell.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is 64 years old, widowed, and has two children, both of whom attend school. She lives in her own house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees for her children.

For the past four years, Fatuma has operated a farming business. She sells to her neighbors and passersby from home. Her major challenge is seasonality, especially during the dry, hot season. 

With the KES 15,000 loan, she wants to purchase fertilizer and seedlings for planting. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance Trust to access loans to boost her business and improve her living standards.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and seedlings for planting.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 53 years old and lives in Prenza, Rangub City with her family. 

To make a living, she owns and manages a farm, planting and harvesting bananas for sale. She borrowed a loan of 19,600 PHP from GDMPC Microcredit to pay the costs of farm weeding and maintenance, and fertilizer such as manure. 

She plans to cultivate the farm and improve their agribusiness in order to gain more income from her farm.

loans.use: to pay for weeding, maintenance, and fertilizer such as manure.

loans.name: Narantsetseg

texts.en:
Mrs. Narantsetseg is 44 years old and lives with her husband and son in a ger (traditional felt housing) in Huvsgul province of Mongolia. Her husband, Purev-Ochir, provides carpentry services in town. Her son, Huvsguldalai, is a university student. 

Narantsetseg has been running an organic fruit and vegetable retail business in a local market since 2007. She has gained a lot of experience and regular customers over the years. She is now planning to grow organic vegetables on her plot of land with the help of her husband and son. 

She is requesting 2,600,000 MNT to purchase seeds and seedlings and to cover other expenses. She is a hardworking, friendly and welcoming lady.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, seedlings and cover other expenses.

loans.name: Saman's Group

texts.en:
Saman, 34, is a widowed lady from Srey Snom district of Siem Reap province. Her main source of income is from 1.5 hectares of land for rice farming. It is the business that she has been in for ages and she is able to earn up to KHR 25,000. 

This is the first microloan for her group, consisting of four female members. The total amount of her group loan is KHR 1,600,000. Saman's portion of the loan is KHR 500,000. 

As the leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer and insecticide for her crops. She hopes to make more income to improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and insecticide for her crops.

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Sharipjon

texts.ru: Шарипджон добросовестный и целеустремлённый человек. Ему 53 года. Он был старшим сыном в семье и с детства помогал родителям по земледелию и скотоводства. После смерти отца он сам управлял этим бизнесом. Вот уже 36 лет как он занимается земледелием и выращиванием сельхоз культуры. Он женат и имеет двоих сыновей и 2 дочерей. Старший сын женат и имеет отдельное домохозяйство. Он построил дом с помощью отца. Его дочери замужем и Шарипджон живет с младшим сыном. Введению бизнеса его жена и сын помогают ему. Его жена продает молоко и кефир. Шарипджон начал перестройку своего дома, так как его дом был маленьким и старым. Он данное время не имеет для того, чтобы завершить перестройку дома. Он запрашивает займ на сумму 2000 сомони для покупки строительных материалов, как цемент, песок, древесина и т.п. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Sharipjon is a conscientious and driven person.  He is 53 years old.  As the oldest son in the family, he helped his parents with farming and animal husbandry since his childhood.  After his father's death, he started to run this business himself.  He has now been involved in farming and growing agricultural crops for 36 years.  He is married and has two sons and two daughters.  His oldest son is married and has a separate business.  He built a house with his father's help.  Sharipjon's daughters are married, and he lives with his youngest son.  His wife and son help him with running the business.  His wife sells milk and kefir.  Sharipjon started to rebuild his house because his house was small and old.  Currently, he does not have money to finish rebuilding the house.  He is requesting a loan in the amount of 2000 somoni to buy construction materials, such as cement, sand, wood and the like.  He awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to buy construction materials, such as cement, sand, wood and the like, to finish rebuilding his house

loans.name: Mirtha Liliana

texts.es: La Sra. Mirtha sigue con la misma actividad de la venta de productos naturales y dietéticos,  cuenta que le fue bien con el anterior crédito ya que lo utilizo para la compra de variedad de productos para diversificar la gama de sus productos  en esta ocasión solicita el crédito para la compra de productos naturales y dietéticos por mayor, se siente feliz y agradecida por la oportunidad que le dan para crecer en su negocio.
texts.en: Mirtha is continuing as before with the sale of natural and dietetic products. She says everything went well for her with the previous loan which she used to buy a variety of products to increase her product range. This time she is asking for a loan to buy natural and dietetic products wholesale. She feels happy and is grateful for the opportunity she is being given to grow her business.

loans.use: to buy dietetic products wholesale

loans.name: Aziz

texts.ru: Азиз молодой парень в возрасте 22 лет. Он очень трудолюбивый и добродушный парень. Женат и имеет двоих детей. Живёт он в доме  своих родителей. Азиз очень любит свою семью и своих родителей и хочет помочь им во всем. Родители Азиза живут на пенсию, поэтому он один в семье, кто приносит стабильный доход. У него есть свой бизнес, который приносит ему хороший доход. Он занимается купля продажей мужской одежды. Этим делом он занимается уже 8 лет. Он привозит свой товар из другой страны и продаёт на местном вещевом рынке. Этому делу он научился с юных лет, он с другими ребятами работал на базаре, помогал продавцам продавать их товар, а теперь у него свой собственный бизнес. Жена  Азиза  домохозяйка, она всё своё время посвящает на то, чтобы воспитывать детей, ухаживает и заботится о них. Сейчас Азиз хочет закупить больше товара для продажи, так как спрос на его товар увеличивается, особенно по сезонам. Поэтому ему нужны денежные средства, и он обратился в Арванд для получения кредита на закуп мужской одежды для продажи. Он надеется на положительный результат и заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en: Aziz is a young 22 year-old man.  He is a very hardworking and kind young man.  He is married and has two children.  He lives in his parents' house.  Aziz loves his family and his parents very much and wants to help them with everything.  Aziz's parents live on their pensions, and this is why he is the only person in the family, who brings in a stable income.  He has his own business, which yields him a good income.  He is involved in buying and selling men's clothing.  He has been in this business for 8 years already.  He brings his merchandise from another country and sells it at a local clothing market.  He learned this business at a young age, when he worked with others at a market, helping sellers to sell their merchandise, and now has his own business.  Aziz's wife is a homemaker; she devotes all of her time to raise the children and take care of them.  Now Aziz wants to buy more merchandise for sale because the demand for his merchandise is increasing, especially according to seasons.  This is why he needs money, and he came to Arvand to obtain this loan to purchase men's clothing for sale.  He hopes for a positive result and thanks Arvand for the support in advance.

loans.use: to purchase men's clothing for sale

loans.name: Saodat

texts.ru: Саодат молодая и весёлая женщина в возрасте 30 лет. Она пока не замужем и живет со своими родителями. С юных лет она обучалась у своей матери шитью одежды. И сейчас она хорошо умеет шить национальную одежду для женщин. Этим она зарабатывает на жизнь, её бизнес заключается в том, что она занимается  шитьем разных национальных женских одежд и занавесок. Саодат является уже мастером своего дело и у неё также есть свои ученицы. Доход она получает от своих заказов на шитьё, и также ей платят некоторую сумму её ученицы за то, что она их учит. В семье есть также дополнительный доход от отца, который работает в России и каждый месяц отправляет денежные средства. Сейчас Саодат готовится к своему замужеству и ей необходимо отремонтировать дом, в котором они живут, привести его в благоприятное состояние. Но ей не хватает денежных средств, которые уже она накопила от своего бизнеса. Поэтому Саодат обратилась в Арванд и хочет получить кредит, чтобы закупить строительные материалы на ремонт своего дома. Она заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en: Saodat is a young and happy 30 year-old woman.  She is not yet married and lives with her parents.  She learned sewing clothing from her mother since young age.  And now she can sew national clothing for women very well.  She earns a living with this; her business is sewing various national women's clothing and curtains.  Saodat is a master of her business and also has apprentices.  She earns an income from sewing orders, and her apprentices also pay her some money for teaching them.  Her family also has another income from her father, who works in Russia and sends money home every month.  Currently, Saodat is getting ready for marriage and needs to repair the house, where they live, and to bring it to a good condition.  However, she does not have enough money saved from her business.  This is why Saodat came to Arvand and wants to obtain a loan to purchase construction materials to repair her house.  She thanks Arvand for the support in advance.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to repair her house

loans.name: Reynaldo

texts.es: Reynaldo tiene 42 años, está casado con Bertha y tiene 2 hijos con quienes vive en su casa construida a base de adobe. Reynaldo es agricultor de cacao orgánico y lleva 25 años como productor independiente gracias a unas parcelas que adquirió cuando era muy joven. Se siente muy orgulloso de ser un gran productor de la zona, pues gracias al permanente apoyo de su esposa e hijos ha logrado evitar la contratación de trabajadores del lugar para las diversas tareas que realiza, pues con la basta experiencia en el campo tienen una gran habilidad en el sembrado, deshierbo y deschuponado de los árboles cacaoteros obteniendo así buenas ganancias y haciendo de este un gran trabajo en equipo. Este es su segundo préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecido por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. En esta ocasión desea contar con 1,000 nuevos soles para comprar sacos de abono orgánico para sus sembríos.
texts.en:
Reynaldo is 42 years old, is married to Bertha and has 2 children who live with him in his house built of adobe bricks. Reynaldo is an organic cocoa farmer and has been working as an independent producer for 25 years as a result of acquiring some plots of land when he was very young. He is very proud of being a large producer in the area. With the permanent help of his wife and children he has managed to avoid having to hire local workers for the various tasks he carries out. With all their experience in the field they are very skilled at sowing, weeding and pruning the cocoa trees and get good profits by working hard together as a team.

This is his second loan with Kiva. He is grateful for the financial help he receives to get on in life and is committed to paying his instalments punctually. This time he is asking for 1000 soles to buy sacks of organic fertilizer for his crops.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer for his crops.

loans.name: Nadou

texts.fr: Femme dynamique de 33ans, Nadou afin de prêter main forte à son conjoint dans les charges du foyer revend au marché et depuis 1998 des objets pour la coiffure (rouleaux, shampoing, pommade….). N’arrivant plus à satisfaire les clients à cause de manque de fonds, elle fait son premier crédit à WAGES pour s’en approvisionner en marchandises afin de répondre au mieux au besoin de ses derniers. Elle espère à l’avenir, renforcer son activité et assurer les meilleures conditions à la famille (Mariée et mère de 04 enfants dont 03 scolarisés). Quant à madame Nadou, elle est âgée de 33ans.
texts.en:
Nadou, age 33, is the married mother of four children, three of whom go to school. She is a dynamic woman who has been selling hair styling products (rollers, shampoo, etc.) at the market since 1998 to help her spouse with the household expenses. 

Unable to meet customer demand due to insufficient capital, she is seeking a first loan from WAGES to stock up on merchandise and better achieve customer satisfaction. In the long term, she hopes to strengthen her activity and to improve her family’s living conditions

loans.use: to buy hair styling products (rollers, shampoo, etc.) for resale.

loans.name: Koffi

texts.fr: Maitre maçon depuis 1983, mr Koffi sollicite un premier crédit à WAGES pour acheter des matériels de travail. Père de 02 enfants, il est marié à une revendeuse et âgé de 57ans. Son souhait est d’agrandir son activité et améliorer les conditions de vie de la famille. Notons qu’il est aidé par 05 personnes.
texts.en:
Mr. Koffi, age 57, has been a master mason since 1983, and he has five helpers working with him. He is married to a reseller, and the couple have two children. 

He is seeking a first loan from WAGES to buy materials. His goals are to expand his activity and to improve his family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy masonry materials.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Gemma works hard to support her family. She buys and sells vegetables and spices in the Philippines, and also earns income from farming vegetables.

Gemma has been sustaining her business activities through her past 28 loans from NWTF and is now borrowing PHP 29500 to purchase additional stocks of vegetables and spices to sell. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchse additional stocks to sell

loans.name: Sokhoeun's Group

texts.en: Sokhoeun is the 63-year-old mother of ten children who lives in the Thmor Koul district of Battambang province. She struggles to earn enough money to get by through selling groceries. She has been in this line of work for 10 years and has made good use of previous loans to strengthen her business and improve her livelihood. Now, she leads a group made up of two women. As the leader, she will use her portion of this loan to buy more groceries to sell. She hopes that she can make more income to meet her needs in the future, especially when she gets older.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to resell.

loans.name: Yaovi

texts.fr: Afin de s’approvisionner en marchandises de quantité considérable, Yaovi fait son premier crédit à WAGES. Le profit tiré de la vente l’aidera à ouvrir une autre boutique et assurer une bonne condition de vie à la famille. Âgé de 26ans, il est marié et père d’un enfant de 08ans.
texts.en: Yaovi, age 26, is a married father to an 8-year-old child. He is seeking a first loan from WAGES to stock up on merchandise to sell. He will use the profits to open another business location, and to provide better living conditions for his family.

loans.use: to buy general food products.

loans.name: Jimboy

texts.en: Jimboy is 24 years old and single. He lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental, where he owns and manages farmland, planting and harvesting vegetables to sell to people in his local community. He has been in his business for years and earns 1,500 PHP every month. Jimboy joined GDMPC last year, and is requesting a loan for 15,000 PHP to buy fertilizer and variety of seedlings. He plans to use the additional revenue generated by his business to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and variety of seedlings.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is 53 years old and married, with one child. She works very hard to provide for her family.

Lorna runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Lorna has been in this business for ten years, selling a variety of items, such as rice, sugar, soap, and other groceries. 

In the future, she would like to build and expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Bahongwere Group

texts.fr: La cliente Jacqueline est membre du groupe d’affaire  « Bahongwere», entrepreneur expérimentée, âgée de 47 ans, veuve et mère de 6 enfants dont 3 étudient. Son conjoint fut décidé d’une courte maladie. La cliente est vendeuse de maïs. Elle installe ses produits dans un entrepôt. Elle commença ses affaires avec  le prêt de l’IMF Hekima, Il y a environ 2 ans. Ce nouveau prêt va lui servir d’acheter 6 sacs de Maïs. Ainsi, elle souhaite accroitre son entreprise, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour son soutien en microcrédit aux petits entrepreneurs.
texts.en:
Jacqueline is a member of the Bahongwere business group. An experienced entrepreneur, she is a 47-year-old widowed mother of six children, three of them in school. Her husband passed away after a brief illness. 

Jacqueline sells maize that she stores in a warehouse. She started this business about two years ago with financial help from the Hekima MFI. She will use this new loan to buy six sacks of maize. She plans to expand her activity, provide for her children, and ensure their education. 

She wants to thank the Hekima MFI for supporting small business owners through micro-financing.

loans.use: to buy 6 sacks of maize.

loans.name: Benita

texts.es: La Sra. Benita  tiene 23 años, casada con dos hijos varones de 4 y 2 años,  vive en la zona de Chuquiaguillo de la ciudad de La Paz que está ubicada a cuarenta minutos del centro de la ciudad. En esta localidad los Comunarios se dedican al lavado de arena y piedra para construcción que sacan del rio. La Sra. Benita se dedica a esta actividad tiene un acopio de materiales de construccion donde vende a distintas construcciones, utilizara el préstamo para la refacción de uno de los motores que utiliza para bombear agua del rio	para el lavado de arena y piedra, la Sra. Benita es una  persona joven  y muy trabajadora se encuentra agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Benita is 23, married and has two sons that are 4 and 2 years old.  She lives in the region of Chuquiaguillo in the city of La Paz, which is located 40 minutes from the center of the city.  In this region the villagers work in separating sand and stones from river water, so it can be used in construction.  

Benita works in this business.  She has a supply of construction materials that she sells to different businesses.  She will use the loan to repair one of the motors that is used to pump water from the river to separate the sand and rocks.  Benita is a young and hardworking person who is thankful to the institution for the assistance offered.

loans.use: to repair one of the motors that pumps water from the river

loans.name: Amélé

texts.fr: Amélé est une femme âgée de 36 ans. Elle est mariée å un peintre bâtiment. Elle a des enfants, dont 3 à l’école. Le premier a 22 ans et le dernier a 5 ans. Amélé travaille comme revendeuse depuis 1992. Elle vend des céréales et des bananes plantain pour tous clients à domicile et dans la ville. Elle achète les produits à Lomé. Elle travaille seule. Au moment, sa difficulté principale est la rupture de stock. Amélé a requis son second crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des tubercules. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité. Dans les prochaines années, Amélé voudrait agrandir la taille de l’activité et faire aussi de l’élevage. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, elle prévoit d’assurer l’éducation de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Amélé, age 36, is married to a house painter. She is a mother with three children in school. The oldest is 22 years old, and the youngest is 5.

Amélé has been working as a reseller since 1992. She sells cereals and plantain to the public out of her home and in town. She stocks up in Lomé. She works by herself. At present, her main challenge is stock shortages.

Amélé is seeking a second loan from WAGES in order to buy merchandise. She plans to reinvest in her business. In the years to come, she would like to expand her business and to start breeding animals. She believes that her profits will help her to provide for her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy cereals and plantain.

loans.name: Patriotas De Patria Group

texts.es:
Un grupo de vecinos y amigos formaron el banco comunal “Patriotas de Patria” en el poblado de Patria.  
Micaela tiene 42 años de edad y vive en el poblado de Patria, ella es una persona responsable y amable que sale adelante pues su actividad económica principal es la compra y venta de fruta como por ejemplo piñas, plátano, naranja, caimito, cocona entonces ella en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar más frutas como por ejemplo piñas para incrementar su capital de negocio. 

Este banco comunal está conformado por varias personas que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos. Los socios se dedican a la agricultura, venta de granos secos, venta de ropa, venta de madera, a la crianza de animales menores, hacer mantenimiento de motocicletas y otras cosas más. 

Los socios en general agradecen la oportunidad brindada y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos. 

(El poblado de Patria se destaca por el comercio de productos de la selva, así como servicios de alojamiento y restaurantes. Punto de ingreso al Parque Nacional del Manu.)
texts.en:
A group of neighbours and friends set up the communal bank "Patriotas de Patria" [patriots of Patria] in the town of Patria. Micaela is 42 years old and lives in the town of Patria. She is a responsible and kind person who gets ahead in life through her main commercial activity which is buying and selling fruit such as pineapples, bananas, oranges, "caimito" [star apple] and "cocona".

At present she needs the loan to buy more fruit such as pineapples to increase her business capital. 

This community bank is made up of various people who are always looking for opportunities to make progress and provide a better future for their children through daily hard work. The members work in agriculture, selling dry grains, selling clothing, selling wood, breeding small animals, motorbike maintenance and other activities. All of the members appreciate the opportunity provided by the loan and are committed to paying off their respective instalments in the agreed timeframes.

(The town of Patria is known for the sale of produce from the jungle as well as services such as accommodation and restaurants. Point of entry to Manu National Park.)

loans.use: to buy more fruit such as pineapples.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase an environmentally-friendly, energy-efficient mini-van to provide his transportation service business.

loans.name: Komlan

texts.fr: Jeune homme de 27ans, Komlan est électricien auto et revendeur de pièces détachées depuis 2010.  Aidé par 03 personnes, il sollicite l’aide de WAGES par un second crédit pour acheter des marchandises.  Komlan désire avoir une autre boutique à l’avenir et avoir une meilleure condition de vie.
texts.en:
Komlan, age 27, has been an automobile electrician and reseller of spare parts since 2010. He has three people helping him. 

He is seeking a second loan from WAGES to stock up on merchandise. He wants to open another business location and to improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to buy spare parts.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Ninfa

texts.en:
Ninfa works hard to support her family. She is married and has a tailoring business in the Philippines.

Ninfa requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy raw materials for her tailoring.

She has been in this business for nine years, and also earns additional income from a general store.

In the future, Ninfa would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her tailoring.

loans.name: Monaliza

texts.en:
Monaliza is 33 years old and married with two children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Monaliza is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Monaliza has been farming rice for eight years, and also earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Roana Mae

texts.en: Roana Mae is 29 years old, married and the mother of one child. She works hard to provide for her family by running a general store in the Philippines. She is requesting a loan for PHP 15000 from NWTF to buy more items to sell such as biscuits, milk, coffee, sugar, cooking oil and other groceries. Roana Mae has taken out and repaid five previous loans from NWTF and has run her general store for the last five years. She supplements her income by raising pigs. Her goal for the future is to earn enough money to provide a secure life to her family.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell.

loans.name: Sinen's Group

texts.en: Sinen, who is in her late 40s, is the widowed mother of three children. For many years, she has been running a small grocery stall in her village in the Thmor Koul district of Battambang province as a way to earn income to cover her family's daily food needs. She earns about 38,900 KHR per day. This is the fifth time she has applied for a loan from VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has fully repaid her previous loans after using them to support her business and improve her family's living conditions. She leads a loan group consisting of two women and will spend her portion of this loan to buy more grocery items to resell, including canned food and instant noodles. She hopes that this purchase will replenish her business and earn her a good profit for the future.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to resell.

loans.name: Kristine

texts.en:
Kristine is 33 years old. She lives in the small village of Abasha District with her husband and five children. Kristine requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for family business start-up, but without any success. Her loan request was rejected all the time, because of low income and her family’s poor living conditions. 

The only source of income for the family is from the agricultural activities. In particular, they have a pig and a milk cow, whose milk is made into cheese products. Besides that, they have a 1.3 hectare plot of agricultural land, where maize is grown. They sell piglets, cheese and harvested maize at local markets. It is hardly enough for food for the family. According to Credo estimations the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Kristine requested a loan from Credo to start-up family business. Kristine has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. 

With the received credit Kristine will begin to buy and sell fruits and vegetables. This will increase the income of their family. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva Start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to begin buying and selling fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Sokhun's Group

texts.en:
Sokhun is 33 years old and married. She has three kids to cater for, two schoolchildren and one small child.  To provide the daily  needs for her children, she does rice farming on half a hectare as the main source of income. She can save up to 2,000 KHR each day after meeting her daily expenses. 

With VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), Sokhun is a second-time borrower while her joint member is a first-time borrower. The past loan which Sokhun has fully repaid has better sustained her rice cultivation in a timely manner. Now, Sokhun is leading a group of two to take out a new loan from VisionFund . The total amount of her group loan is 900,000 KHR, of which 400,000 KHR is Sokhun’s portion. She will spend her loan portion to buy two sacks of fertilizer and to plow her farmland.  She hopes to earn more income, as much as possible so as she can save some money for future needs.

loans.use: To buy two sacks of fertilizer and to plow her farmland

loans.name: Elio

texts.es: El Sr. Elio tiene 38 años, casado con 3 hijos que son de las edades de 6, 1, 12 años,  el  Sr. Elio realiza la elaboración de colchones de paja más conocidos como payasas la cual vende a intermediarios q los llevan hacia las poblaciones más alejadas y rurales del departamento de Santa Cruz, su domicilio se encuentra ubicado en la zona de Santa Rosa,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, el  Sr. Elio va a usar este préstamo para la compra de materia prima que en este caso sería la paja que por el temporal es de color verde por lo cual tarda en secarse para poderse utilizar en la elaboración de colchones para su negocio,  el  Sr. Elio enfrenta retos en su negocio que son existen varias personas también que realizan la misma actividad  por lo cual deben tener una elaboración más rápida de los mismos colchones por lo cual, la inclemencia del tiempo y las bajas temperaturas puede causarles distintas dificultades,  va a utilizar los beneficios poder mejorar su realidad económica,  El deseo del cliente es tener más producción para poder sacar a sus hijos adelante.
texts.en:
Elio is 38 years old, married with 3 children who are ages 6, 1 and 12.  Elio makes straw mattresses known as “payasas” which he sells to middlemen that take them to the more remote and rural towns of the department of Santa Cruz.  His home is located in the area of Santa Rosa.  

This loan is his first sequence within the institution.  Elio is going to use this loan to buy raw material which in this case would be the straw that for the time being is green in color and it takes a while to dry out in order to be able to use it in the manufacture of mattresses for his business.  

Elio faces challenges in his business such as that there are several people that also do the same activity and so he must produce the same mattresses faster.  The inclement weather and low temperatures can also cause various difficulties for them.  He is going to use the profits to improve his economic situation.  His dream is to have more production in order to be able to get ahead with his children.

loans.use: to buy straw for the manufacture of straw mattresses.

loans.name: Unguruza Group

texts.fr:
Dénise  fait partie du groupe Unguruza et habite à  Gitega. Elle  a 35 ans et est mariée à  Claver, un commerçant. Ensemble ils ont 3 enfants,  âgés de  4  à 9 ans, dont 1 étudie.  

Elle fait le commerce de bananes  depuis 5  ans. 

Elle est à son deuxième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle va  augmenter son capital et acheter  une grande quantité de bananes à revendre pour gagner plus.
texts.en:
Dénise, age 35, is a member of the Unguruza group and she lives in Gitega. She is married to a merchant named Claver. They have three children aged 4 to 9, one of whom is in school. She has been selling bananas for five years. 

This is her second loan cycle with Turame. She plans to use the funds to bolster her working capital. She will purchase large quantities of bananas to sell in hopes of increasing her revenue.

loans.use: to buy large quantities of bananas to sell.

loans.name: Kossi

texts.fr: Revendeur et conducteur de taxi –moto, Kossi sollicite son second prêt à WAGES pour acheter des appareils électroménagers (activité qu’il mène depuis 2007). Il espère avec le profit avoir une boutique pour exposer ses marchandises et assurer l’éducation de la famille. Il est marié et père de 06 enfants tous scolarisés.
texts.en: Merchant and motorcycle taxi driver,  Kossi is requesting his second loan from WAGES to buy electrical household appliances (a business he has run since 2007). He hopes with the profit to have a shop where he can display his merchandise and to ensure the education of his family. He is married and the father of six children, all of them enrolled in school.

loans.use: to buy electrical household appliances

loans.name: Ra's Group

texts.en:
Aged 25, Ra is a young father who does rice cropping. He resides in a village located in Battambang province’s Thmor Koul district. During his spare time, he also drives a kind of transportation vehicle called “Ro Mork”, a motorcycle pulling a trailer full of people, in order to earn supplemental income. He has engaged in the current business for three years. 

Ra has never been with VisionFund Cambodia (Kiva’s partner) before. He is joining a group consisting of two male borrowers, including himself, to take a new loan. 

Ra will spend his loan portion to buy five sacks of fertilizer, to pay for plowing fees, and to buy insecticide for his farmland. He hopes to increase his income and improve his lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy five sacks of fertilizer, to pay for plowing fees, and to buy insecticide.

loans.name: Ruben

texts.es: Ruben tiene 34 años, es soltero sin hijos y vive en una casa de madera que compró hace 5 años con el fruto de su esfuerzo. Ruben se dedica a la producción de cacao orgánico y tiene un promedio de 10 años realizando está actividad. Para una apropiada labor en el campo generalmente cuenta con el apoyo de trabajadores del lugar quienes realizan un excelente trabajo en sus terrenos de cultivo. En el futuro desea convertirse en un comprador de productos agrícolas ya que podrá adquirir mejores ganancias y así asegurarse un buen futuro. Este es su segundo préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecida del apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir con sus planes a futuro, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Con los 2,000 nuevos soles comprará abono orgánico para su próxima campaña agrícola.
texts.en:
Rubén, 34, is single with no children.  He lives in a wood house he bought five years ago with the fruit of his effort.  

Rubén works growing organic cacao and has been doing this for about 10 years.  To provide adequate work in the fields he gets help from local laborers who do excellent work on is farmland.  In future, he’d like to become a buyer of agricultural products because he’ll be able to earn higher profits and insure a better future for himself.  

This is his second Kiva loan and he’s grateful for the financial support he gets to continue with his plans for the future.  He also commits to make his payments punctually.  He will use the 2,000 new soles to buy organic manure for his next planting cycle.

loans.use: to buy organic manure for the next planting cycle.

loans.name: Mufariji Group

texts.fr: La cliente Rachel est membre du groupe d’affaire « Mufariji», jeune entrepreneur expérimentée, âgée de 34 ans, mariée et mère de 7 enfants qui étudient tous. Son conjoint est un maitre maçon constructeur. La cliente est vendeuse de ciments. Elle dispose un entrepôt de vente ciments. Elle commença ses affaires avec  le prêt de l’IMF hekima, Il y a environ 4 ans. Ce nouveau prêt va lui servir d’acheter 6 sacs de ciments. Ainsi, elle souhaite accroitre son entreprise, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour son soutien en microcrédit aux petits entrepreneurs.
texts.en: Hekima client Rachel is a member of the business group called "Mufariji", a young but experienced entrepreneur, aged 34, married, and the mother of seven children who are all enrolled in school. Her spouse is a master mason/builder. The client sells cement. She has a storeroom where she sells the cement. She began her business with an MFI Hekima loan about four years ago. This new loan will allow hter to buy six sacks of cement. In this way she would like to grow her business, pay school fees and feed her children. She would like to thank Hekima sincerely for helping small entrepreneurs with micro-loans.

loans.use: to buy six sacks of cement

loans.name: Tuongozane Group

texts.fr: La cliente Chigolo est membre du groupe d’affaire  « Tuongozane»,  jeune entrepreneur expérimentée, âgée de 37 ans, mariée et mère de 6 enfants qui étudient tous. Son conjoint est un chômeur, sans emploi. La cliente est vendeuse d’huile de palme. Elle installe ses produits au marché public et parfois à son domicile. Elle commença ses affaires avec  son fonds propre reçu de son mari, Il y a environ 18 ans. Ce nouveau prêt va lui servir d’acheter 4 bidons d’huile de palme. Ainsi, elle souhaite accroitre son entreprise, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour son soutien en microcrédit aux petits entrepreneurs.
texts.en:
Hekima client Chigolo is a member of the business group called « Tuongozane»,  a young but experienced entrepreneur aged 37, married and the mother of six children who are all enrolled in school. Her husband is jobless. Chigolo sells palm oil. She displays her goods at the public market and sometimes in her home. She began her business with her own money, received from her husband, around 18 years ago. 

This new loan will allow her to buy four jerrycans of palm oil. In this way, she hopes to grow her business, pay school fees, and feed her children. To close, she would like to sincerely thank Hekima for its support in terms of micro-loans to small business people.

loans.use: to buy four jerrycans of palm oil.

loans.name: Las Fresas Del Algodonal Group

texts.es: Las fresas del algodonal es una alcancía conformada por 6 socios. Oscar es uno de sus integrantes, el tiene 47 años es conviviente y tiene 05 hijos, se dedica al transporte público tiene una moto taxi con la que realiza servicio de transporte, diariamente trabaja alrededor de 15 horas y lleva trabajando cerca de 05 años, gracias a su trabajo puede solventar  los gastos que su familia necesita. Oscar quiere este préstamo para reparar su moto y así seguir trabajando, su máximo anhelo es comprarse otra moto para poder tener más ingresos para su familia. Oscar quiere darle gracias a todos los Inversionistas de KIVA que hacen posible obtener este crédito, en la foto esta sentado.
texts.en:
The “Las Fresas del Algodonal” (The Cotton Field Strawberries) communal bank consists of six members.  Oscar is one of them.  He’s 47-years-old and has five children.  He works providing public transportation service; he owns a mototaxi that he uses to provide transportation.  He works about 15 hours daily and has been working for about five years.  Thanks to his work he’s able to cover his family’s expenses.  

Oscar wants this loan to repair his mototaxi to continue working.  His greatest wish is to buy another mototaxi so that he can earn higher family income.  Oscar wants to thank all Kiva lenders that make getting this loan possible. In the photo, he’s seated.

loans.use: to repair his mototaxi.

loans.name: Mujeres Rumbo Al Progreso Group

texts.es:
Esta es la alcancía Mujeres Rumbo al Progreso
Antonia tiene 49 años y 06 hjijos.Ella es trabajadora independiente hace varios años, desde muy joven su mama le enseño a trabajar, actualmente tiene un puesto de verduras en un mercado de su distrito, allí vende verduras y tubérculos frescos. Su trabajo es muy sacrificado porque tiene que empezar desde muy temprano abasteciéndose de productos para luego venderlos, sus clientas son  amas de casa que diariamente le compran y son fieles a ella debido a la calidad de sus productos y la buena atención que les brinda, su trabajo le ha permitido ayudar a sus hijos con su educación lo cual la hace sentirse feliz, con este nuevo préstamo podrá seguir invirtiendo en su negocio con la compra tuberculos al por mayor. Mas adelante quiere seguir creciendo con su negocio.
 ¡Antonia le agradece su apoyo! En la foto viste buso color plomo con rayas plomas.
texts.en:
This is the “Mujeres Rumbo al Progreso” (Women on the Way to Progress) communal bank.  Antonia, 49, has six children.  She’s been working independently for several years.  Her mother taught her to work when she was very young.  

She currently has a vegetable stand in one of her district’s markets where she sells vegetables and fresh tubers.  Her work is very demanding because she has to start very early stocking up on products to then resell.  Her customers are housewives who buy from her daily and are faithful to her because of the quality of her products and the good service she provides.  

Her work has made it possible for her to help with her four children’s schooling which makes her very happy.  With this new loan she will be able to continue investing in her business with the purchase of tubers at wholesale.  Later on she wants to continue growing with her business.  Antonia thanks you for your help.  In the photo, she’s wearing a gray sweatshirt with gray stripes.

loans.use: to buy tubers at wholesale.

loans.name: Akoko

texts.fr: Akoko est une jeune dame de 32ans. Elle est mariée à un restaurateur et ils ont 03 enfants tous à l’école. Ils sont âgés de 13,10 et 05ans. Pour aider son conjoint dans les charges du foyer, elle fait le commerce de pagnes. Elle expose ses marchandises sur étalage et vend de différentes variétés de pagnes. Afin d’avoir une boutique et améliorer les conditions de vie de la famille, elle sollicite un troisième crédit à WAGES pour acheter des marchandises, revendre et pouvoir atteindre ses objectifs à l'avenir.
texts.en:
Akoko, age 32, is a young woman married to a restaurant owner, and they have three children aged 5, 10 and 13 who go to school. She sells pagnes to help her husband support the household. She puts her merchandise on display, offering several different styles of pagnes. 

She is seeking a 3rd loan from WAGES to stock up on merchandise. The revenue from her sales should help her to achieve her goals of opening a store and improving her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy pagnes for resale.

loans.name: Elio

texts.es:
Elio es un hombre adulto de 63 años, creció en el campo y al terminar sus estudios de primaria, se dedicó a las labores del campo junto a su familia, luego siendo muy joven se casó con Tomasa  que ahora tiene 57 años con quien tuvo hijos que ahora ya viven independientemente y cada uno con su respectiva familia. A este hombre lo conocen en la comunidad por su sencillez y solidaridad con todos quienes le rodean. Elio vive con su esposa en el Cantón de Salcedo ubicado en la parte Oriente de Cotopaxi una de las provincias más importantes de la Sierra ecuatoriana. En Salcedo existen varios atractivos turísticos como lagunas y balnearios que ofrecen deportes extremos para sus turistas aventureros, sin embargo la principal actividad que desarrollan en este pueblo es la agricultura y en menor cuantía la ganadería. Los productos agrícolas más comercializados son granos como arveja, fréjol, lenteja, haba y también varias frutas y verduras. La producción de leche y sus derivados abastece la distribución interna y el excedente se envía a la Región Costa en productos ya procesados. La crianza de animales es también muy favorable por el  clima agradable del que se goza en el Cantón. A pesar de estas actividades productivas, hay índices muy preocupantes de analfabetismo y de pobreza por necesidades básicas insatisfechas como por ejemplo el servicio de alcantarillado que solo lo tienen el 25% de los hogares. 
La agricultura y ganadería ha sido la labor de Elio durante toda su vida, tiene algunas vacas a las cuales cuida y además le producen leche para la posterior venta, actividad a la cual le dedica al menos cuatro horas cada día.
