loans.use: To purchase cosmetics and households goods for his shop

loans.name: Jihan

texts.en:
Jihan is a 44-year-old mother of 5 children living in Tulkarem area.

She took a loan from ACAD to rehabilitate the irrigation network for her thyme farm by buying new pipes, a pump, and a water tank. The new irrigation system will increase the efficiency and allow her to expand her production.

Jihan starting her thyme farm by investing in a bee hive project, then she decided to start this thyme farm, and now she collects the thyme, dries it, and sells it to the local market.

Her future goals are to develop her project and to plant another piece of land with peach trees. Jihan sees the lack of labor and the difficulties in marketing in winter as her main challenges, as well as wild pigs that destroy the plants.

loans.use: to rehabilitate the irrigation network for her thyme farm

loans.name: Norwin Aaron

texts.es:
El señor Norwin Aaron posee un negocio de venta de Ropas usada ubicada cerca de la terminal de buses del departamento de león.

Este negocio de señor Norwin Aaron lo ha ido haciendo crecer para en un futuro sea el sostén de su familia ya que igual su familia lo indujo a este tipo de negocio.

El inicia sus labores muy de mañana a las 8 am para ofrecerles a los diferentes clientes retirándose a su hogar alas 5:30 pm para descansar.

El  crédito que esta solicitando a Ceprodel será utilizado para compra de pacas de ropas usada, gorras, zapatos y bolsos para así ofrecerle a su clientela una variedad de productos de mejor calidad para satisfacerles su demanda por lo que tendría más ingresos para mejorar su nivel de vida de ella y su familia.
texts.en:
Norwin Aaron has a second hand clothing business located near the bus terminal in the department of León.

He has been growing his business so that in the future he can support his family, since it was his family who encouraged him to get involved.

Norwin Aaron starts his work day at 8:00 a.m. and tends to customers until 5:30 p.m., when he goes home.

The loan he is requesting through Ceprodel will be used to buy packs of used clothing, caps, shoes and bags.  This will allow him to offer more variety to his customers to satisfy demand.  His income will increase and this will improve his and his family's lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy second hand clothing, hats, shoes and bags.

loans.name: Oydinoy

texts.ru: Добрый человек, который всегда старается улучшить условию проживания, и надеется на светлое будущее, нуждается финансовой поддержки. Ее зовут Ойдиной. Ей 42 года. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 3  детей. Так как она живет в сельской местности, так и имеет хорошую возможность для развития своего бизнеса, скотоводством. Она более 22 года занимается скотоводством и имеет большой опыт по данной отрасли бизнеса. Она так хорошо ухаживает за своим скотом, словно знает и понимает язык своего скота. Благодаря хорошему состоянию скота, она имеет своих постоянных клиентов. Она хочет развевать бизнес и получать больше дохода. С полученного дохода она планирует улучшить условию проживания. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 1300 долларов США для покупки скота. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: A kind person, who always tries to improve living conditions and hopes for a bright future, needs financial support.  Her name is Oydinoy.  She is 42 years old, married and raising three children.  Because she lives in a rural area, she has a good opportunity for developing her animal husbandry business.  She has been involved in animal husbandry for over 22 years and has a lot of experience in this business area.  She takes such good care of her livestock, as if she knows and understands the language of her livestock.  Thanks to the good condition of the livestock, she has regular customers.  She wants to develop her business and earn a higher income.  Oydinoy plans to use the resulting income to improve her living conditions.  She is requesting a loan in the amount of 1300 US dollars to buy livestock.  She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to buy livestock

loans.name: Adjovi

texts.fr: Adjovi est mariée et n’a pas d’enfants en charge. En 2011, elle a démarré la vente des produits d’alimentation générale et sollicite un premier crédit à WAGES pour acheter des marchandises (riz, tomate, huile….). Le profit lui permettra de rendre pérenne son activité et de mieux s’occuper de sa famille. Elle est âgée de 26ans.
texts.en: Adjovi is married, and has no children under her care. In 2011 she started selling general food items, and has asked for her first loan from WAGES to buy more merchandise (rice, tomatoes, oil, etc.). The profits she makes will allow Adjovi to make her business more sustainable, as well as to better provide for her family. She is 26 years of age.

loans.use: To buy general food items.

loans.name: Klousse

texts.fr: Afin de renforcer son stock de céréales et prendre soin de sa famille (marié et père de 06 enfants dont 01 scolarisé), Klousse fait une demande de crédit à WAGES pour pouvoir répondre à ses besoins. Avec une ancienneté de 25ans dans l’activité, il s’approvisionne à Lomé et dans les villes reculées du pays et s’y plait bien car cela lui procure des revenus considérables. Âgé de 44ans, son souhait est d’élargir son terrain de distribution et pourquoi pas exporter les céréales à l’étranger.
texts.en:
Klousse has requested a loan from WAGES in order to increase his cereal stocks and take care of his family (he is married and has six children, one of whom is at school). He has worked in this business for 25 years, and gets his supplies in Lomé and remote villages throughout the country. He is pleased with his business as it provides him with considerable income. 

Klousse is 44 years of age. His wish is to increase his distribution area, as well as to export cereals abroad.

loans.use: to buy cereals.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica, age 50, raises, breeds, and sells pigs to earn an income. She is married and lives in Labuyo, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental.
 
Monica joined GDMPC in 2009 in order to gain access to financial services. Her goal was to help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. 

She is presently requesting a loan of PhP 18,000 to buy more piglets to raise and sell. 

In the future, Monica plans to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy piglets

loans.name: Faith

texts.en: Faith is 37 years old, a widowed single mother with four children. She is a resident of Kawempe Lugoba. Faith has an obligation of taking care of her children by paying their tuition and providing for their basic needs, from the small income she earns from her business. She started this business seven years ago as source of income after she had lost her husband in 2006. She started the business as a way of supporting herself and her family, since she is the breadwinner for the entire family. Faith’s business is strategically located, but her major challenge is inadequate capital, which is not sufficient to buy enough stock for her business, which in turn hinders its growth and expansion, which is why she is applying to be funded. Her neighbors recommended her as a hardworking, determined and supportive person in their society.

loans.use: to buy retail stock items.

loans.name: Chreb

texts.en:
Chreb is a farmer. She manages two hectares of cassava crops and about one hectare of rice. Her farming activities constitute the primary source of income for her entire family. She is the mother of three schoolchildren and lives in the Dambae district of Kampong Cham province. Chreb has been involved in her current business for 11 years, earning about 25,800 KHR per day. 

This is not her first loan from Kiva partner VisionFund, as she has been with VisionFund for three cycles already. Through her previous loans, she improved her family's living conditions, and she has fully repaid her most recent loan. 

For this cycle, she is requesting a loan in the amount of 1,500,000 KHR, which she will utilize to plow her farmland, buy potash, and purchase insecticide. 

She hopes to support her agribusiness in a profitable and ongoing manner and wishes to make it a strong business.

loans.use: to plow her farmland, buy potash, and purchase insecticide

loans.name: Poy's Group

texts.en: Poy, 33, is a local farmer who grows rice and cassava as her main sources of income. She is married and has four dependent kids, who are in school. She has three hectares of cassava farmland and one hectare of rainy season paddy, which she has farmed for five years, and which have earned her about 40,000 KHR per day. Poy has been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for four cycles. After the past successful loan, which she has completely repaid, she feels confident that she can relieve her family’s burdens better than before. Poy is now forming a group of three to take out a new loan from VisionFund. She and one of her fellow group members are seeking 2,000,000 KHR each, while the remaining borrower is applying for 1,000,000 KHR. As the group leader, she will spend her loan portion to pay for plowing fees and labor costs, and to buy potash and insecticide for her two cash-crops. She confidently expects good yields, so that she can keep her kids in school until the tertiary level.

loans.use: to pay for plowing fees and labor costs, and to buy potash and insecticide for her crops.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en: Gemma is 47 years old, married, and has three children, one of whom is in school. Gemma is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Gemma applied for a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. Gemma has been raising pigs for two years, and she has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business. In the future, Gemma would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima, age 30, is a hairdresser. She has been engaged in this business since January 2005. She started her business in order to supplement her husband's income, since his employment in a gas station is not enough to cover the family's needs. Fatima and her husband have three children to support.
 
Fatima is applying for a youth loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua in order to buy a car, which will help her expand her working area. At present, she works from home, but with this investment she is planning to provide her services to customers in nearby villages by visiting them in their own homes. This is an additional customer service that most of her customers would like to have.
 
As Fatima also sells beauty cosmetics and accessories, buying and selling these products will also be easier once she acquires a vehicle.
 
Fatima is planning to expand her business more in the future, and hopes eventually to open a beauty salon that will include a cosmetics and accessories shop.

loans.use: to buy a car so that she can expand her customer base

loans.name: Llenifer Marfransoli

texts.es:
LLENIFER MARFRANSOLI

ESTE ES EL SEGUNDO CREDITO QUE SOLICITA DOÑA LLENIFER EN FAPE Y EN EL PRIMER CREDITO MOSTRO MUCHA RESPONSABILIDAD, ELLA SE DEDICA DESDE HACE MAS DE CINCO AÑOS A LA CRIANZA Y ENGORDE DE ANIMALES DE CORRAL COMO LO SON: CERDOS Y GANADO VACUNO AHORA SE HA DEDICADO A LA ELABORACION DE QUESOS ARTESANALES LOS CUALES VENDE EN EL MERCADO DE LA LOCALIDAD A DIARIO, ELABORA POR LO MENOS CIEN QUESOS Y POR EL SABOR Y CALIDAD SE LE VENDEN MUY BIEN, DOÑA LLENIFER SOLICITA EL CREDITO PARA LA COMPRA DE CERDOS PARA ENGORDAR, CONCENTRADO DE ENGORDE Y CRECIMIENTO PARA ANIMALES DE CORRAL Y ARTICULOS PARA LA ELABORACION DE LOS QUESOS.
texts.en:
Llenifer Marfransoli

This is Llenifer’s second Fape loan request.   She demonstrated much responsibility with her first loan.  She’s worked for more than five years raising and fattening up barnyard animals like pigs and cattle and now also makes artisanal cheese that she sells daily in the local market.  She makes at least 100 cheeses and they sell well because of their flavor and quality.  Llenifer is asking for the loan to buy pigs to fatten up, feed concentrate for her barnyard animals and cheese-making supplies.

loans.use: to buy pig feed and animals to raise.

loans.name: Pedro Pablo

texts.es: El Sr. Pedro, es casado con sus dos hijos y su esposa vive en un pequeño pueblo llamado Puerto la Esperanza de Chontales, hace mas de 16 años se desempeña como Auxiliar de Enfermería de un Hospital, es su único medio de ingresos en vista de que solamente él trabaja. Solicita el préstamo para construir un cuarto de 16 varas cuadradas ya que ve la necesidad de más espacio para su familia en su hogar para gozar de mayor privacidad, don Pedro agradece el apoyo de financiamiento, porque le brinda la facilidad de ir pagando poco a poco.
texts.en:
Pedro is married.  He lives with his two children and his wife in a small village called Puerto la Esperanza de Chontales.  He has been working as a nurse’s aid at a hospital for 16 years.  It is his only form of income in light of the fact that only he works.

He is requesting the loan to build a 16 square ‘vara’ [vara is approximately one yard] room.  His family needs more space in their home in order to enjoy more privacy.  Pedro is grateful for the financial support because it offers him the ease of paying little by little.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Dúo Venceremos Group

texts.es:
DUO VENCEREMOS
Doña Angelina es originaria de la Aldea Xetzac, Tecpan, ella tiene 54 años de edad y tiene bajo su responsabilidad a 2 hijos menores de edad, ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de quesos y crianza de animales.
Desde hace años doña Angelina esta comprando leche para elaborar quesos para venderlos en el mercado ya que es el medio que tiene para salir adelante con su familia.
Su esposo se dedica al comercio  y gracias al apoyo de el y de toda su familia  ella sigue trabajando, para poder salir adelante con su familia.
El sueño de ella es ampliar mas su negocio para obtener mejores ganancias y mandar a sus hijos a la escuela,esta solicitando este credito para la compra de animales para la crianza.
texts.en:
Venceremos Duo

Angelina is from Aldea Xetzac, Tecpan.  She's 54 years old and is responsible for two minor children.  She earns a living making and selling cheese and raising animals.

For years Angelina has been buying milk to make cheese to sell in the market because it's her means to get ahead with her family.  Her husband makes a living in commerce, and thanks to his and her whole family's help she continues working so she can get ahead with her family.

Her dream is to expand her business more to get better profits and send her children to school.

She's requesting this loan to buy animals to raise.

loans.use: to buy animals to raise

loans.name: Marjorie

texts.en:
Marjorie, age 53, sells new and used school supplies to earn an income. She has been engaged in this business for the past six years and makes PhP 5,000 per month. Marjorie and her husband have four children and live in Catadman, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental.

Marjorie joined GDMPC just last year because she believes it is a a way to improve her family's living conditions. She is applying for a loan in the amount of PhP 14,500 in order to buy school supplies such as notebooks, pads of paper, and crayons to offer for sale.

loans.use: to buy school supplies such as notebooks, pads of paper, and crayons to offer for sale

loans.name: Patrocenio

texts.en: Patrocenio, 32 years old, lives in Mialen, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. He is married and has two kids. To make a living, Patrocenio operates a motorcycle transport business. He's been in this business for 10 years, and he earns 5,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) a month. He has been a member of GDMPC since 2009. Recently, he took out a loan of 23,000 PHP to buy new set of tires and spare parts. He plans to buy an additional motorcycle for business expansion and to help his family with their daily living expenses.

loans.use: to buy a new set of tires and spare parts, for his motorcycle transport business.

loans.name: Jelar

texts.en: Jelar is married, 26 years old, and the mother of two sons. Her husband is a carpenter, and she helps by tending their farm and harvesting corn for sale. She took out a loan from GDMPC microcredit, which she joined recently, in order to buy fertilizer, such as manure. She plans to cultivate the unused land on their farm in order to earn more income for the future of the entire family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, such as manure.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en: Wilma is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling bananas in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy more bananas to sell in her business. Wilma has been in this business for 10 years. Wilma earns additional income from a general store. Wilma has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy more bananas to sell.

loans.name: Sofia

texts.en:
Sofia, age 58, raises ducks to earn an income. She has been running this agricultural business for the past 12 years, and she has borrowed and repaid 16 loans from NWTF to sustain her business. Sofia and her husband have five children.

Sofia has requested a PhP 14,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feed for her ducks.

In the future, Sofia would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy feed for her ducks

loans.name: Wilyn

texts.en: Wilyn is 39 years old and single. Wilyn is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Wilyn applied for a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies for her pigs. Wilyn has been in this business for two years, and she has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain the business. Wilyn would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase feed and other supplies for her pigs.

loans.name: Nurila

texts.ru: Нурила, 47 лет, замужем, имеет 3 детей (2сына и 1 дочь). Образование средне-специальное. По специальности бухгалтер-кассир. С 1998 года занимается полеводством и животноводством. Имеет большой опыт в этих областях. Бизнес начала с суммы 10000 сом(KGS). Супруг Нурилы помогает по хозяйству. На сегодняшний день она смогла развить полеводческую деятельность, и ежемесячная прибыль ее семьи от хозяйства составляет 10000 сом(KGS). Также есть свое хозяйство. В хозяйстве у нее имеется: 1 дойная корова, 2 нетели и 20 овец, а также имеется 3,20 ГА поливной земли на которой она ежегодно выращивает картофель. В целях дальнейшего развития своего  хозяйства и полеводства Нурила обратилась в Микрофинансовый Банк «Бай-Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 45 000 сом (KGS) на покупку удобрений для картофеля. Доходы от кредита Нурила планирует вложить в свадебное мероприятие младшего сына.
texts.en: Nurila is 47 years old, married and has three children (two sons and one daughter).  She has a secondary-specialized education.  She is an accountant-cashier.  She has also been involved in farming and animal husbandry since 1998.  She has a lot of experience in these business areas.  She started the business with a sum of 10,000 som (KGS).  Nurila's husband helps her with the household.  To-date, she was able to develop her farming business, and the monthly profit from the business amounts to 10,000 som (KGS).  She also has her own farm that contains one dairy cow, two heifers and twenty sheep, and also has 3.20 hectares of irrigated land, where she annually grows potatoes.  In order to further grow her farming and animal husbandry business, Nurila requested a loan in the amount of 45,000 som (KGS) from the Microfinance Bank "Bai-Tushum and Partners" to buy fertilizers for potatoes.  She plans to invest the earnings from the loan into a wedding event for her youngest son.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for potatoes

loans.name: Mwanakombo

texts.en: Mwanakombo, 26, is a single mother of one child, who attends school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is for food. For the past two years, she has operated a beauty salon, selling to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of expanding and establishing a boutique business in the future. With the loan that she is applying for, of KES 10,000, she wants to buy cosmetics, hair pieces and hair oil. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, hair pieces and hair oil for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Vakhtang

texts.en:
Vakhtang is 41 years old. He lives in Samtredia District with his wife, parents and two children. Vakhtang applied for a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan requests were always rejected, because of his low income and the family’s poor living conditions. The only source of the income for the family is from agricultural activities. In particular, they have a greenhouse, where cucumbers are grown. Besides that, they have a plot of agricultural land, where nut trees are grown. They sell the harvested nuts and cucumbers at local markets. It hardly provides enough for food for the family. 
According to Credo’s evaluations, the family belongs to the “subsistence poor” category. Vakhtang applied for a loan from Credo to start up a family business. Vakhtang has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provding business start-up and re-startup credits on soft conditions to rural poor people who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. With the credit Vakhtang will buy a milking cow. After purchasing the cow, they will be able to produce dairy products to sell, and thus increase the income of their family. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to buy a milking cow.

loans.name: Genaro

texts.es: Genaro  de 33 años de edad se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 15 años su principal siembra es el frijol y el maíz con las ganancias que obtiene logar cubrir algunos gastos de su hogar, vive en casa de un familiar con su compañera de vida y su hija, Genaro esta solicitando un credito para comprar semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, herbicidas, controles de plaga, etc. asi como muestra la fotografía para poder seguir con sus cosechas y poder seguirle dando a su familia lo que necesita sin limitación alguna.
texts.en: Genaro, 33 years old, has been farming for 15 years. His main crops are beans and corn. With the revenue he generates, he covers some household expenses. He lives in a family member's home with his wife and daughter. Genaro is requesting a loan to purchase seeds, fertilizer, compost, herbicides, pest control, etc., as shown in the photo, to be able to continue harvesting and to be able to continue giving his family what they need without any limitation.

loans.use: purchase seeds, fertilizers, compost, herbicide, pest control, etc.

loans.name: Ludy

texts.en:
Ludy is a married woman with 2 children.  She is 45 years old and resides in Malibangcao, Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines.  She operates a motorcycle transport business to earn a living.

Ludy is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy a new set of tires.  She has been a member of GDMPC since 2008.  In the future, she plans to save her earnings for the education of her children and to purchase one more motorcycle.

loans.use: to buy a new set of tires.

loans.name: Ahamd

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 22-year-old single man who has been working in the metal business since 2006.  He specializes in working with aluminum.  Ahmad is well known in his region with an excellent reputation among competitors.  He finished intermediate school and transitioned to work in order to help his parents to improve their living and to develop their socioeconomic situation.

Ahmad is applying for a youth loan from Kiva's partner, Al Majmoua.  He plans to buy the necessary, updated machines for his business such as an aluminum-compressing machine and a compiling machine.  This is his first experience as an Al Majmoua borrower.  He hopes that the future loan will be invested in opening new branches and in increasing employees beyond the one he has now.

loans.use: to buy new equipment for working with aluminum.

loans.name: Elsa Isolina

texts.es: Doña elsa de 49 años de edad se dedica a la venta de artículos para fiestas como: piñatas, vasos, platos, dulces, etc. desde hace varios años tiene mucha clientela por sus buenos productos y a buen precios, vive en casa propia con su familia, con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas logra cubrir algunos gastos de su hogar, doña elsa está solicitando un crédito para poder comprar más mercadería por mayor para poder seguir con su negocio y seguir llevando el pan de cada día a su hogar sin limitación alguna.
texts.en: Elsa, age 49, has sold party supplies such as piñatas, cups, plates, and candy for many years. She has many clients because of her good products and good prices. She lives in her own home with her family. With her income from her sales, she covers some of the household costs. Elsa is requesting a loan for the purchase of more merchandise in order to continue with her business and to continue making a living without any limitation.

loans.use: to purchase paper products and wire

loans.name: Walter Antonio

texts.es: Walter de 34 años de edad tiene un negocio de lavado de carros desde hace 5 años lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia en una zona muy transitada  tiene muchos clientes pues es una persona muy trabajadora, responsable y amable con los clientes, vive en casa propia con sus padres no esta casado y no tiene hijos, con las ganancias que obtiene de su trabajo ayuda en los gastos que tiene en su hogar, Walter esta solicitando  a INTEGRAL un préstamo para comprar las herramientas necesarias para seguir con su trabajo como: jabón liquido para lavar los vehículos, una maquinas de vapor, tanques para depositar agua, etc. y asi complacer a sus clientes y poder tener mas trabajo que le deje mejores ganancias y asi seguir ayudando en su hogar sin limitación alguna.
texts.en: Walter is 34 years old and has had a car wash business for 5 years, located in his home in a high traffic neighborhood. He has many customers as he is very hardworking, responsible, and friendly with the customers. He lives in his own home with his parents. He is not married and does not have any children. With the earnings from his work he helps with the household expenses. Walter is asking INTEGRAL for a loan in order to buy the necessary tools needed to continue working such as: liquid soap to wash vehicles, steam machines, tanks to hold water, etc. and in this way he can better satisfy his customers and be able to have more work that will then give him better income and in this way continue helping in his home without any difficulty.

loans.use: to buy liquid soap to wash cars, steam machines, tanks to hold water, etc.

loans.name: Roeurn

texts.en: Roeurn is 33 years old and married.  In order to earn a living, she grows rice on a hectare of land and raises pigs.  She has engaged in this business since she was 20 years old.  Now, her current income is up to 38,000 KHR per day.  Roeurn has never been with VisionFund before.  She is now requesting a loan to plow her farmland, to buy fragrant seed and potash, and to pay for labor cost for harvesting.  She hopes to make more income to improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: to plow her farmland, buy fragrant seed and potash, and to pay for labor costs.

loans.name: Carolina De Lourdes

texts.es:
La señora carolina  vive en la cuidad de Managua trabaja como secretaria en una empresa del estado. es una persona responsable honesta.

Doña carolina  está haciendo la solicitud de un crédito para  gastos médicos  y compra de medicamentos para su mama.

Confiando en DIOS  y espera del apoyo de kiva y ceprodel ya que con este financiamiento podrá realizar los gastos necesario para que mejore la salud de su mamá.
texts.en: Señora Carolina lives in the city of Managua and works as a secretary in a company of the state. She is a responsible, honest person. Doña Carolina is asking for a loan to cover medical expenses and to buy medicine for her mother.  She trusts in God and hopes that with the support of Kiva and Ceprodel this loan will allow her to cover the expenses necessary to improve her mother's help.

loans.use: with medical expenses.

loans.name: Aleksi

texts.en:
Aleksi is 51 years old.  He is married and lives in Akhmeta district with his wife and school-aged son.  The family runs a small-scale agricultural business that has a cow whose milk is sold locally.  Aleksi’s wife works as a local school principal and receives a monthly salary.  Aleksi has made multiple loan requests, without success, from the local financial institutions in order to start up a trading business.  His loan requests were rejected each time due to low income.  

Aleksi’s loan request was approved as part of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo.  The start-up loan program provides business start-ups and re-startups with credit with soft conditions.  Borrowers are the rural poor who do not have access to credit products, since they are regarded as ‘high-risk borrowers’ because of their low income.  With the received credit, Aleksi will purchase basic groceries and set up a store.  He plans to increase the turnover in his trade business gradually.  

The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly increase the income of the family.  Aleksi will work hard, and he will be able to improve the living conditions for his family.  With this loan, his family will generate enough income to access regular credit products in the country’s capital market, in the event that they need it.

loans.use: to purchase groceries.

loans.name: Marcos Tulio

texts.es: Marcos de 37 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus dos hijos, el tiene un taller de enderezado y pintura desde hace 15 años, su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia, tiene mucha clientela pues su trabajo lo realiza muy bien, es muy responsable y amable, con las ganancias que obtiene de su trabajo logra cubrir algunos gastos de su hogar, marcos está solicitando un crédito para poder comprar materiales como: pinturas, barniz, pulidoras, etc. y poder seguir con su negocio para poderle dar a su familia una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Marcos is a 37-year-old man who lives in his own house with his wife and two children. For 15 years he has had his own body and paint shop located inside his place of residence.  He has many customers because he does his job very well.  He is very responsible and friendly, and he covers his household expenses with the earnings that he obtains from his job.  

Marcos is asking for a loan to buy materials such as: paints, varnish, polishers, etc, and to continue with his business in order to provide his family a better financial stability.

loans.use: to buy materials: paints, varnishes, polishes, etc.

loans.name: Purevchuluun

texts.en:
Mrs. Purevchuluun is a 45-year-old woman who lives with her husband and 2 sons in a ger, in the Huvsgul province of Mongolia.  In 2000, her husband started a business selling animal pelt and raw materials in the local market.  Her sons, Purevbaasan and Badrah, both work at a local company. 

Purevchuluun helps her husband to run their business.  She is now planning to grow organic vegetables on their plot of land for both family usage and for sale.  As such, she is requesting 1,500,000 MNT to purchase seeds, seedlings, and soil.  She is a hardworking and well-communicative person.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, seedlings, and soil.

loans.name: Annielyn

texts.en:
Annielyn is married and has two children. She is 36 years old and resides at Guingona, Ozamis City. She supports her family by running a general store and she has been in this business for more than eight years. Each month she earns about 3,000 PHP doing this type of business. 

Annielyn joined GDMPC in 2010. Recently she requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy canned goods, bottled products, and pastries for sale.

In the future, Annielyn wants to make improvements to her house and enable her children to complete their studies.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, bottled products, and pastries for sale.

loans.name: Andres

texts.es:
Andres es un hombre soltero de 49  años de edad, vive junto a sus 10 hijos 4 hombres y 6 mujeres en el Barrio el Calvario Sololá, Sololá.
Es un hombre amable y sobre todo trabajador, el se dedica a fabricar prendas de vestir típicas que se utilizan las mujeres  indígenas de su región.
Junto a su familia  se apoyan para realizar esta actividad usando como principal herramienta llamado  (telar) donde coloca el hilo para luego realizar estas prendas. El inicio este trabajo hace 4 años porque se dio cuenta que eran pocos los fabricantes de este tipo de  prendas y que mantienen precios buenos en el mercado, de esta manera obtiene  buenas ganancias, a través de lo que realiza contribuye a la economía de su familia.
El está solicitando un préstamo de Q 4,500.00  para comprar otra maquina de coser para la elaboración de prendas típicas con la finalidad de mejorar la calidad de su producto.
Su sueño es tener 6 maquinas para poder elaborar más prendas de vestir y un local para colocar sus productos para incrementar sus ganancias y darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
49-year old Andres is single and lives with his ten children, four sons and six daughters, in the neighbourhood of Calvario Sololá in Sololá. He is a friendly man and above all very hardworking. He makes the clothing worn by the local women of the area.

With help from his family Andres obtains the yarn which he then weaves into clothing. He started his business four years ago when he realized that there were few people making this type of clothing and that prices were good. He makes good money which he contributes to family finances.

He is now seeking a loan of Q4,500.00 to buy another machine to make traditional clothing so that he can improve the quality of the garments. His dream is to have six machines, make more clothes, and have premises where he can put them. In this way he would earn more money and provide his family with a better standard of living.

loans.use: Buy a machine for weaving traditional clothing

loans.name: Ly

texts.en:
Ly, a mother in her early 50s, is a local farmer from Kampong Cham province where her residential area is. She has 10 children, two of whom still rely on her as they are in school. She deals with daily cost of living via two hectares of rice cropping, four hectares of cassava farming, and two and half hectares of rubber tree farming. This is the business that she has occupied for ages.

Ly is a first time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She is now taking out a loan in order to lease additional farmland for planting more cassava and to buy potash for her crops. She hopes this purchase will enable her to expand her agribusiness larger than before and grow fruitful crops with a good income in return.

loans.use: to lease additional farmland for planting more cassava and to buy potash for her crops.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Silvia Teresa

texts.es: La señora Sivia, de 49 años de edad habitante de Villa Reconciliación, una zona marginal de Managua, es una mujer soltera madre de tres hijos con quienes busca como salir adelante, en la actualidad Silvia se dedica a su pequeña pulpería, en el que desea invertir con productos, es por esta razón que solicita el apoyo de crédito y continuar con las ventas para la manutención de sus hijos y así poder pagar los diferentes gastos que se le presentan que en muchas ocasiones se le dificulta un poco debido a la carencia de productos para ofrecer.
texts.en:
Silvia is 49 years old and a resident of Villa Reconciliación, a poor area of Managua. She is a single woman and mother of three children with whom she is looking to get ahead.  

Currently Silvia is earning a living from her small grocery store, which she wants to invest in with various products.  It is for this reason that she is asking for the support of a loan and to continue sales in order to care for her children. It is difficult for her to pay the different expenses due to lack of products to offer.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, dairy products, various meats, and sweets, among others

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cement, sand, and ceramic tiles

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer and corn seeds

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.es: La Sra. Vicenta  tiene 60 años, casada con hijos ya independientes  ella se dedica  a la elaboración y  venta de queso y leche ya que tiene ganado vacuno, el vive en la localidad de Batallas, la gente de la población se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería, este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución,  La Sra. Vicenta  utilizara  este préstamo para la compra  de una vaca lechera y quiere aprovechar esta oportunidad,  Su razón para solicitar este préstamo es no tiene dinero  para la compra ya que esto le beneficiara de gran manera  ya que  proporcionara  buena cantidad de leche y así de esta manera producir más quesos y leche y mejorar sus ingresos económicos, La Sra. Vicenta  enfrenta retos en su negocio que son el forraje que debe comprar cada cierto tiempo, y  utilizara los beneficios mejorar su ganado y su deseo es poder elaborar quesos por mayor y ofrecer a los distintos mercados de la ciudad de La Paz.
texts.en:
Vicenta, 60, is married and has children who are all independent now.  She works making and selling cheese and milk since she has dairy cattle.  She lives in Batallas.  People from that town work in agriculture and raising cattle.  

This loan is her first sequence in the institution and Vicenta will use it to buy a dairy cow; she wants to take advantage of this opportunity.  Her reason for requesting the loan is that she does not have money for the purchase which will be of great benefit to her because a good amount of milk will be produced and she will then be able to make more cheese and milk and improve her income.  

The business challenge Vicenta faces is forage that must be purchased every so often.  She will use benefits to improve her cattle; her wish is to be able to make cheese at wholesale to sell in various markets in the city of La Paz.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Emelia

texts.en:
Emelia is 50 years old and she is from Gango, Ozamis City. She is married and has three children. 

To earn a living, Emelia owns and operates a general store. Emelia been engaged in her business for more than six years and earns 6,500 PHP each month for these activities. 

Recently she requested a loan of 30,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase rice and corn grits for sale. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from her business to improve her family’s general living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase rice and corn grits for sale.

loans.name: Alerma

texts.en:
Alerma is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business raising pigs in the Philippines. Alerma has been in this business for 11 years. Alerma earns more income from general store and food vending.

She is borrowing PHP 23000 through NWTF to purchase feed and other supplies for her pigs. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Alerma has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase feed and other supplies for her pigs.

loans.name: Ayat

texts.ru: Аят, 42 года, замужем, имеет 3 детей (2 дочери и 1 сын). Образование-среднее. После окончания средней школы Аят рано вышла замуж. Работает на автозаправочной станции, в должности оператора. Супруг занимается предоставлением пассажирских услуг населению. С 1991 года занимается сельским хозяйством- животноводством и полеводством, начав этот бизнес с суммы 15 000 сом(KGS). Ежемесячная прибыль ее семьи составляет 15000 сом(KGS). Благодаря упорному труду и терпению Аят, на сегодняшний день она имеет небольшое хозяйство: 4 дойные коровы. Также в наличии имеет 1 ГА поливной земли, на которой выращивает: клевер, кукурузу и картофель.  Прибыль позволила Аят размножить скот в домашнем хозяйстве и тем самым улучшить семейное благосостояние. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Аят обратилась в Микрофинансовый Банк «Бай-Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50 000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота. Доходы от кредита Аят планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение количества скота.В ближайщем будущем хотят построить дачу.
texts.en:
Ayat is 42 years old, married and has three children (two daughters and one son). She has secondary education. After finishing high school, Ayat got married. She works as an operator at a gas station. Her husband works with providing passengers services to the public. 

Since 1991 Ayat has been engaged in livestock breeding and field crop cultivation, after having started this business with an amount of 15,000 som (KGS). The family's monthly income is 15,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Ayat's patience and persistent work, she currently has a small farm with four dairy cows. Further she has 1 hectare of irrigated land available, on which she grows clover, sweet corn and potatoes. The income made it possible for Ayat to multiply the number of livestock, and thereby increase the family's well-being. 

With an aim to further develop her business, Ayat turned to the microfinance bank "Bai Tushum & Partners" for a loan in the amount of 50,000 som (KGS) for the purchase of livestock. Ayat plans to invest the income from the loan in further increasing the number of livestock. In the near future, they would like to build a dacha (second/seasonal home).

loans.use: to purchase cows and sheep

loans.name: Kanygul

texts.ru: Каныгул, 32 года, замужем, мать 2 детей (сын и дочь). Образование-среднее. После окончания средней школы Каныгул вышла замуж. С 2009 года занимается сельским хозяйством- животноводством и полеводством, начав этот бизнес с суммы 5 000 сом(KGS). Супруг помогает по хозяйству. Семья очень дружная, на жизнь настроены оптимистично. Прибыль позволила Каныгул размножить скот в домашнем хозяйстве и тем самым улучшить семейное благосостояние. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Каныгул обратилась в Микрофинансовый Банк «Бай-Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100 000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота. Доходы от кредита Каныгул  планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение количества скота.
texts.en:
Kanygul is 32 years old, married and the mother of two children (a son and a daughter). She has secondary education. After finishing high school, Kanygul got married. 

Since 2009 she has been engaged in livestock breeding and field crop cultivation, after having started a business with the amount of 5,000 som (KGS). Her husband helps her with the business. The family is very friendly with an optimistic view of life. The income from the business allowed Kanygul to multiply the number of livestock and thereby improve the family's well-being. 

With an aim to further develop her business, Kanygul turned to the microfinance bank "Bai Tushum & Partners" for a loan in the amount of 100,000 som (KGS) for the purchase of livestock. Kanygul plans to invest the income from the loan in further increasing the number of cattle.

loans.use: to purchase cows and fertilizer

loans.name: Darikha

texts.ru: Дариха, 51 год, замужем, имеет 1 сына. Супруг-преподаватель в колледже. Сын со своей семьей проживает в России, помогает родителям, высылая им деньги. Дариха начала свой бизнес по продаже одежды в 2000 году с суммы в 50000 сом(KGS). Благодаря упорному труду и настойчивости Дарихи, ежемесячная прибыль от бизнеса составляет 8000 сом(KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Дариха обратилась в Микрофинансовый Банк «Бай-Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100 000 сом (KGS) на расширение ассортимента реализуемого товара за счет летней одежды. Доходы от кредита Дариха планирует вкладывать в развитие бизнеса, посредством увеличения оборота, а также в будущем хотела бы отремонтировать свой дом.
texts.en: Darikha is 51 years old, married and has one son.  Her husband is a professor at a college.  Her son lives with his own family in Russia, he helps his parents by sending them money.  Darikha started her own business selling clothing in 2000 with 50,000 KGS.  Thanks to her hard work and perseverance, her monthly profits are around 8,000 KGS.  With the goal of further developing her business, Darikha turned to the microfinance bank Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan of 100,000 KGS to expand the assortment of summer clothing she offers.  She plans to reinvest the income from the loan in her business, by increasing turnover.  She also hopes, in the future, to make repairs to her home.

loans.use: to buy clothes for resale

loans.name: Perla

texts.es:
Perla es de la ciudad de San Ignacio, Misiones, es una mujer con grandes deseos de superarse, por lo que sigue estudiando para poder fomentar su educación y seguir creciendo como persona.
Ella cuenta que está siguiendo la carrera de Administración de Empresas, con lo que ella en el futuro se ve trabajando en un banco de la ciudad. Además de eso cuenta que su familia la motiva a seguir adelante, vive con su mama,  ya que su  padre ya falleció hace dos años, también tiene varios hermanos a los que quiere ayudar.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en el pago de las mensualidades de su carrera, y así poder seguir estudiando para ser una buena profesional.
texts.en:
Perla is from the city of San Ignacio, Misiones.  She’s a woman with a strong wish for self-improvement which is why she’s studying to foster her education and continue to grow as a person.

She relates that she’s studying Business Administration which she hopes in future will lead to a job with a bank in the city.  She also relates that her family motivates her to continue moving forward.  She lives with her mother since her father died two years ago; she also has several siblings she’d like to help.

She’s requesting this loan to pay for her monthly tuition and be able to continue studying to become a good professional.

loans.use: to pay university tuition and fees.

loans.name: Apu Kañacway Group

texts.es:
Un grupo de vecinos y amigos formaron el banco comunal “Apu Kañacway” en el poblado de Patria.  

Josefa tiene 41 años de edad y vive en el poblado de Patria, ella es una persona responsable y amable que sale adelante pues su actividad económica principal es la venta de productos de primera necesidad como por ejemplo arroz, azúcar, fideos, aceite, detergentes, jaboncillos. Ella en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar sacos de arroz, sacos de azúcar para incrementar su capital de negocio. 

Este banco comunal está conformado por varias personas que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos. Los socios se dedican a la agricultura, venta de madera, comestibles, venta de comida, a la crianza de animales menores y otras cosas más. 

Los socios en general agradecen la oportunidad brindada y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos. 

(El poblado de Patria se destaca por el comercio de productos de la selva, así como servicios de alojamiento y restaurantes. Punto de ingreso al Parque Nacional del Manu.)
texts.en:
The community bank Apu Kañacway is made up of a group of friends and neighbours from the community of Patria.

41-year old Josefa lives in Patria. She is a responsible, friendly person who is doing well as she earns her living selling basics such as rice, sugar, pasta, oil, detergent, and soap. She now needs a loan to buy bags of rice and sugar and increase her working capital.

This community bank comprises a group of people who are always looking for ways to get on and who make a daily effort to provide their children with a better future. The members are involved in agriculture, selling wood, groceries and food, and raising animals etc.

They are grateful for this opportunity and promise to pay back the money according to the established schedule.

(The community of Patria is known for its products from the rainforest, its accommodation and restaurants, and because it is the gateway to the Manu National Park.)

loans.use: Buy bags of rice and sugar

loans.name: Alberta

texts.es:
Alberta nació en la comunidad de Tahuantisuyo en la provincia de Paucartambo pero actualmente vive en la ciudad  de Paucartambo, ella tiene 25 años edad y es madre y padre para su único hijo. 

Alberta es una mujer luchadora y trabajadora a pesar de las adversidad supo salir adelante entonces su actividad económica principal es trabajar para en una entidad pública en el área de limpieza pero también se dedica a la venta compra de animales menores ósea a la crianza de animales menores como cuyes y gallinas. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Señor De Torrechayoc” y en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar más animales menores como cuyes. Agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales. 

(La ciudad Paucartambo está ubicada en el distrito del Paucartambo en la provincia de Paucartambo dentro del departamento de Cusco, Perú).
texts.en:
Alberta was born in the community of Tahuantisuyo in Paucartambo province but she currently lives in the city of Paucartambo. She is 25 years old and is mother and father to her only son. 

Alberta is a fighter and a hard worker. She has been able to get ahead in spite of adversity. Her main job is cleaning for a public organization but she also does business selling and buying small animals. That is, she raises small animals like Guinea pigs and chickens. She has been in this business for several years and it is going very well for her because she puts a lot of effort into her work. She belongs to the communal bank Señor De Torrechayoc, and this time she is requesting a loan in order to purchase more small animals like Guinea pigs. She appreciates and values the loan and promises to comply with the payment of her monthly installments.  

(The city of Paucartambo is located in the district of Paucartambo, in Paucartambo province, department of Cusco, Perú).

loans.use: to buy more small animals like Guinea pigs.

loans.name: Alina

texts.ru: Алина, 41 год, замужем, мать 3 детей (1 дочь и 2 сына). Образование-среднее. Дети маленькие. Старшая дочь пошла в первый класс. С 2007 года занимается сельским хозяйством- животноводством и полеводством, начав этот бизнес с суммы 20 000 сом(KGS). Ежемесячный доход семьи составляет 8000 сом(KGS). Супруг Алины помогает ей по хозяйству. Благодаря упорному труду Алины, на сегодняшний день она имеет небольшое хозяйство: 1 дойная корова, 1 теленок,, 2 лошади, 10 овец.  Прибыль позволила Алине размножить скот в домашнем хозяйстве и тем самым улучшить семейное благосостояние. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Алина обратилась в Микрофинансовый Банк «Бай-Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 40 000 сом (KGS) на покупку коровы. Доходы  от кредита Алина планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение количества скота.
texts.en: Alina is 41 years old, married, and a mother of three small children (one daughter and two sons).  She has a  degree.  Her oldest daughter just entered the first grade.  Since 2007, Alina has worked in agriculture and with livestock, having started her business with 20,000 KGS.  The monthly income for the family is around 8,000 KGS.  Alina's husband helps her run the business.  Thanks to her hard work and perseverance, today Alina has one dairy cow, one calf, two horses and ten sheep.  The profits from the business have allowed Alina to breed her animals which have provided a way to improve the family's circumstances.  With the goal of further developing her business, Alina has turned to Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan of 40,000 KGS to buy a cow.  Alina plans to use the income from her loan to further invest in her business and increase the number of animals in her care.

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Leilanie

texts.en: Leilanie, 25 years old, is married and has two children. She lives in a village, in the San Pedro province of Isabela. She has managed a store for three years. In addition to the store, her family has a small farm that is managed by her husband. Leilanie is very hardworking mother, and she makes sure that she can meet all the needs of her family. She is asking for a loan amounting to PHP 8,000. She will use it to buy spices, noodles, shampoo, soap and snack foods, to resell at her store.  Leilanie hopes that her store's sales will grow, so that she can meet all the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy inventory for her store, including spices, noodles, shampoo, soap and snack foods

loans.name: Olga Marina

texts.es: Olga, tiene 39 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su pareja con quien tiene  2 hijos, vive en una aldea que pertenece al municipio de santa Cruz de Yojoa. Desde hace 16 años mantiene su cultivo de café, al que le ha dado mantenimiento mediante la inversión de préstamos. La producción la vende en el mercado local en pergamino húmedo. Actualmente solicita el quinto ciclo de préstamo que es por 10,000 lempiras, con el cual esta fertilizando, sembrando y limpiando su finca de café. Su objetivo es darle calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Olga is 39 years old and lives with her common-law husband. They have two children together and live in a village that belongs to the municipality of Santa Cruz de Yojoa. 

She has been running her coffee plantation for sixteen years, and has done so by investing loans. She sells her product, which is wet parchment coffee, in the local market. 

She is currently requesting a fifth loan cycle for 10,000 lempiras, which she is using to fertilize, plant, and clear her coffee crops. 

Her goal is to provide quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and clear her coffee crops.

loans.name: Thoeurn's Group

texts.en:
Thoeurn is 52 years old and villager from Kampong Cham province’s Prey Chhor district, where agribusiness is running. She supports her family through rice paddy cultivation and working for others for a fee. Having been with this business for 21 years, she is able to generate about 23,600 KHR per day.

Thoeurn, a third-time borrower, join with a fourth-cycle borrower to apply for a new loan from VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). The past loan - which she has fully repaid back - allowed her to uplift her living conditions better than before. Moreover, she afforded to buy household appliances including a table and TV for her family.

In this cycle, she and her co-borrower are seeking 500,000 KHR each. As the leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer, rice seed, and pay for the leasing fee. She hopes that she can gain a high yield that is better than last year.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, rice seed, and pay for the leasing fee.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Serafina

texts.es:
Serafina es una persona con grandes sueños y ganas de ser una profesional excelente, está estudiando la carrera de enfermería con ese propósito, cuenta que se esfuerza por tener buenas calificaciones y estudia mucho.
Su familia la apoya mucho, y quiere poder ayudarlos por medio de su profesión. Ella sueña con poder ayudar a las personas en su salud, es por eso que eligió esta carrera.
Hoy solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en comprar sus útiles de la universidad, y también utilizarlo en otros gastos que surjan, agradece por esta oportunidad de crecimiento que esta recibiendo.
texts.en:
Serafina is a person with big dreams and the wish to become an excellent professional.  She’s studying Nursing with that end in mind.  She relates that she strives to get good grades and studies much.

Her family supports her very much and she wants to help them by means of her profession.  She dreams with being able to help people with their health and this is why she chose this career.

Today, she’s requesting this loan to buy supplies for the university and also to use it for any other expenses that might arise.  She is thankful for this growth opportunity she’s receiving.

loans.use: to buy university supplies and to pay other expenses.

loans.name: Josie

texts.en:
Josie is a hog raiser. She is 44 years old and blessed with three children. Her profit from selling hogs helps a lot in sending her children to school. Her priority in life is to send her children in school and for them to earn a college degree.  

This goal made her borrow a loan of PHP 25,000 to further make her business profitable. She plans to utilize the loan to buy hog feed to sell in their village . She hopes to make the business grow for it is a big help in their family.

loans.use: to buy hog feed to sell in their village.

loans.name: Dorila

texts.es: Dorila, tiene 51 años de edad, es madre soltera, vive con sus tres hijos en el municipio de Santa Cruz de Yojoa. Hace 10 años ella estableció en su casa una pulpería donde vende productos alimenticios, como arroz, frijoles, azúcar, café, manteca, pastas, jabón, churros, dulces etc. Para mantener estable su negocio ha invertido dos préstamos anteriormente y actualmente ha decidido solicitar un tercer ciclo que es por 15,000 Lempiras, los cuales los invertirá en la compra de productos alimenticios para surtir la pulpería. Su objetivo es poder ayudar a sus hijos con el estudio y mantener siempre su negocio.
texts.en:
Dorila, 51, is a single mother living with her three children in the municipality of Santa Cruz de Yojoa.  She opened a grocery store at home ten years ago where she sells foodstuffs like rice, beans, sugar, coffee, shortening, pasta, soap, snacks, candy, etc.  

To maintain her business’ stability she’s invested two previous loans and now has decided to request a third one for 15,000 Lempiras that she’ll use to buy stock merchandise for her grocery store.  Her objective is to be able to help with her children’s schooling and to always maintain her business.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for four years now, and she works hard to support her family.

Delia requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business. In the future, Delia would like to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is married and runs a small shop to support her family. She has wanted to grow her business but hasn’t had the money to do so. 

Maria is now applying for a 600 USD loan through TRM to buy additional supplies to keep in her store such as electrical wire and fittings, lamps, shoes and flip-flops. She is grateful to TRM for offering loans to poor people.

loans.use: to buy more stock for her store.

loans.name: Rey

texts.en:
Rey, 52, is a citizen of a rural village in the district of Bovel in the Battambang province of Cambodia. She is widowed and has six children to take care of. Two of them are dependents and still in school. 

To feed her family, Rey has worked hard as a farmer. She has grown corn for several years and sometimes works for others for a fee to better feed her children. Her current business earns her about 34,000 Cambodian riel (KHR) per day. 

Rey has been with VisionFund for three cycles. She has completely repaid her past loans, which have helped her better support her family and improve their living conditions. 

She is now applying for another loan of 3,000,000 KHR to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her corn field. She hopes to grow healthy corn to increase her family’s income and make a better living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticides for her corn field

loans.name: Jacenta

texts.en:
Jacenta is 47 years old. She requested a loan amount of 1,200,000 UGX. She is married with five children, all of them in school. She is a tea farmer in Kyabugimbi Kyamuhunga. She works in the garden for three hours every day, except for Sunday. Her other source of income is coffee farming from which she receives some income. She started her business to sustain the family and raise school fees for her children. 

She is going to buy fertilizers for her tea plantation. She is also going to start tea trading with the money. However, she says that she lacks adequate capital to fully profit from her business. She is an honest lady in terms of financial management which is a reason she has financed her previous loans very well. She applauds the institution for the quick service provided.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizers

loans.name: Touch

texts.en:
Touch, 56, is married with five children. She lives in a wooden house with her family in a rural village in the district of Dambae in the Kampong Cham province of Cambodia. She and her husband earn a living through planting rubber and cassava. 

Touch has been in this business for six years. She earns about 16,000 Cambodian riel (KHR) per day and can save about 8,000 KHR each day for future needs. 

This is Touch’s third microloan with VisionFund. She successfully used past loans to better support her standard of living and pay for her children’s education. She is now requesting a loan of 3,000,000 KHR to buy pesticides and fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes to increase her yields and earn more income to further improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy pesticides and fertilizers for her farmland

loans.name: Nahum Isaias

texts.es: Nahúm, tiene 28 años de edad, esta casado, tiene dos hijos y vive el municipio de Santa Cruz de Yojoa. Desde niño a trabajado en la agricultura, produce, café, rambutanes, plátano  y maíz. La producción la vende en el mercado local de la zona.  Ha solicitado un segundo préstamo a ODEF, por 20,000 Lempiras con el fin de comprar fertilizantes para la finca y para elaborar un vivero y sembrar mas planta. Su plan es seguir dándole mantenimiento para mejorar la producción y los cultivos.
texts.en:
Nahúm is 28 years old, married, has two children and lives in the municipality of Santa Cruz de Yojoa. Ever since he was a child he has been involved in agriculture growing coffee, rambutanes (lychees), bananas, and corn. He sells the produce in the local market.

Nahúm is seeking a loan of 20,000 lempiras from ODEF to buy fertilizer for his land and to form a nursery where he can grow more plants. His business plan is to continue looking after his crops well and thus improve production and crops.

loans.use: buy fertilizer and to form a nursery where he can grow coffee plants

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for his degree.

loans.name: 06.1.13 Đông Vệ Group

texts.en:
Thi operates a food stall/restaurant selling vegetables. She is requesting a loan to purchase vegetables to resell.

Thi is 62 years old and she is married with three children. She is the group leader of the 06.01.13 Đông Vệ solidarity group, which consists of three members. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with no dependents because her children are grown up.

In 2011, Thi joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. She has successfully repaid four loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She has been involved in this business for three years. The main hardship that Thi faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Thi hopes for her business to do well, for her children to find good jobs, and to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables to resell.

loans.name: Lope

texts.en:
Lope is 40 years old, single and in the farming business. He is glad that he can earn a minimum net income of PHP 10,000 each harvest season twice a year. He wanted his business to grow for him to support the needs of his parents and other family members.  

Lack of capital encouraged him to borrow a loan from the lenders in the amount of PHP 20,000. This will be used to buy pesticides and herbicides which are very useful in his farming business.  

Lope hopes for the continuous growth of his business and to become a successful farmer someday.

loans.use: to buy pesticides and herbicides.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe, age 64, runs a general store to earn an income. She has been engaged in her business for the past six years and works hard to help support her family. She and her husband have three children.

Fe has requested a PhP 19,500 loan through NWTF. She will use her loan funds to re-stock her store with foodstuffs and household goods to offer for sale, such as sugar, milk, cream, coffee, and canned goods.

In the future, Fe would like to build and expand her business in order to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to re-stock her store with items such as sugar, milk, cream, coffee, and canned goods

loans.name: Jeffrey

texts.en:
Jeffrey lives with his parents in Bañadero, Ozamiz City.

To earn a living and to help to support the family, he provides motorcycle transportation services in their community. He has been in this line of business for years.

He is seeking a loan in the amount of 15,000 PHP from GDMPC micro credit to buy a set of tires for his motorcycle. In the future, he plans and hopes to have another motorcycle to be used for expanding his service-based business.

loans.use: to purchase a set of tires

loans.name: Pov

texts.en:
Pov, 43, is widowed with no kid. Her family lives in a house with a thatched roof house in the Sa Ang Village of Kandal province and the main source of the family’s income is selling rice and snacks. Pov can earn about US  $5 per day to meet the family’s needs. 

This is the second microloan for Pov with VisionFund. She fully repaid the past loan which has helped her better support her current business. Now she is asking for another loan to buy a motorbike for her family’s commuting.  She hopes to have a decent motorbike for her family to commute to work so as to reduce money on a motor-taxi’s fee.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her family’s commuting

loans.name: Sarat

texts.en:
Sarat, a parent of seven children, is 50 years old and is a resident of the Srey Snom district in Siem Reap province.

She supports her family by growing rice. She has been engaged in this line of business for years and explains that she is able to generate approximately 30,000 KHR per day from the business.

Sarat has been with VisionFund (Kiva's partner) for the past three loan cycles and has fully repaid back her previous loan. She is happy to report that her living conditions are improving. For this cycle, she is seeking a loan in the amount of 4,000,000 KHR to buy fertilizer and insecticides for her crops. She hopes to boost her crop yield so that she can increase her income.

loans.use: To increase her crop yield by purchasing fertilizer and insecticides

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Carmela

texts.en:
Carmela is 67 years old, is married, and has 10 children. 

Carmela is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. She requested a loan of 27,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy more fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Carmela has been farming rice for eight years now, and has borrowed 15 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Carmela would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Sandra

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Sandra works hard to support her family. She has a bicycle transport business in the Philippines, and also earns income from her general store.  Sandra is borrowing PHP 8000 through NWTF to purchase spare parts and other materials for the repair of her bicycles.

Sandra has been sustaining her business activities through her past 1 loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and other materials for the repair of her bicycles

loans.name: Leoniza

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Leoniza works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from pig fattening. Leoniza is borrowing 17,000 PHP through NWTF to buy fishing materials for her fishing business.

Leoniza has been sustaining her business activities through her past 18 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials for her business.
